analyzed: zhi ba / mi 'jig pa /
translated: peaceful, indestructible,

original: rang bzhin gyes yongs su dag /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyes yongs su dag /
translated: pure by nature,

original: nyon mongs pa'i sbubs thams cad las grol ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sbubs thams cad las grol ba /
translated: free from all the cocoons of afflictions,

original: rnam par dbyer med pa //
analyzed: rnam par dbyer med pa //
translated: indivisible,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma las 'das pa dang ldan pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi skur bstan pa ste /🔽bcom @81a * //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma las 'das pa dang ldan pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi skur bstan pa ste / bcom @81a * //
translated: It is endowed with the inconceivable qualities of the Buddha, beyond the sands of the Ganges in number, and is revealed as the dharmakaya of the Tathagata.

original: ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku 'di nyid nyon mongs pa'i sbubs las ma grol ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes bgyi'o zhes gsungs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku 'di nyid nyon mongs pa'i sbubs las ma grol ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes bgyi'o zhes gsungs pa bzhin te /
translated: Bhagavan, this very dharmakaya of the Tathagata, when it is not free from the cocoon of afflictions, is called the tathiigatagarbha.

original: thams cad rgyas par ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i bden pa rnam par gzhag pa rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad rgyas par ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i bden pa rnam par gzhag pa rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The full explanation of this is to be understood according to the sutra, in the context of the presentation of the truth of the cessation of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i ming can de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku 'di thob pa'i rgyu rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes mthong ba dang / sgom pa'i lam ni chos mthun pa rnam pa gsum nyid kyis nyi ma dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i ming can de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku 'di thob pa'i rgyu rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes mthong ba dang / sgom pa'i lam ni chos mthun pa rnam pa gsum nyid kyis nyi ma dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
translated: The cause for attaining this dharmakaya of the Tathagata, which is named the cessation of suffering, is nonconceptual wisdom. This is to be understood as being like the sun in three ways, through its similarity to the sun in terms of the path of seeing and the path of meditation.

original: dkyil 'khor rnam par dag par chos mthun pas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rnam par dag par chos mthun pas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like a pure maṇḍala because it is free from all the stains of the secondary mental afflictions.

original: gzugs gsal bar byed par chos mthun pas ni shes bya ba thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad snang bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs gsal bar byed par chos mthun pas ni shes bya ba thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad snang bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like a lamp that illuminates forms because it illuminates all aspects of all objects of knowledge.

original: mun pa'i gnyen por chos mthun pas ni de kho na mthong ba'i gegs kyi rnam pa thams cad gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mun pa'i gnyen por chos mthun pas ni de kho na mthong ba'i gegs kyi rnam pa thams cad gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like the antidote to darkness because it is the antidote to all the aspects that obstruct the vision of reality.

original: gegs kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i dngos po rgyu mtshan gyi yul yid la byed pa sngon du 'gro ba can bag la nyal ba dang kun nas ldang ba dang ldan pas /
analyzed: gegs kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i dngos po rgyu mtshan gyi yul yid la byed pa sngon du 'gro ba can bag la nyal ba dang kun nas ldang ba dang ldan pas /
translated: The obstruction is the mental activity that precedes the object of the unreal sign, and it is associated with the latent and manifest afflictions.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug skye'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug skye'o //
translated: From that, desire, hatred, and delusion arise.

original: bag la nyal las ni yang dag pa ma yin pa de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i dngos po byis ba rnams la 'dod chags bskyed pas na sdug pa'i rnam par ram /
analyzed: bag la nyal las ni yang dag pa ma yin pa de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i dngos po byis ba rnams la 'dod chags bskyed pas na sdug pa'i rnam par ram /
translated: From the latent afflictions, the unreal nature of things generates desire in the childish.

original: zhe sdang bskyed pas khong khro ba'i rnam par ram /
analyzed: zhe sdang bskyed pas khong khro ba'i rnam par ram /
translated: or, when hatred is generated, in the form of hostility;

original: gti mug bskyed pas ma rig pa'i rnam pas rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gti mug bskyed pas ma rig pa'i rnam pas rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ro //
translated: or, when delusion is generated, in the form of ignorance.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi rgyu mtshan yang dag pa ma yin pa de yang dmigs par byed pas na tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pas sems yongs su len to //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi rgyu mtshan yang dag pa ma yin pa de yang dmigs par byed pas na tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pas sems yongs su len to //
translated: Since one perceives that unreal sign of desire, hatred, and delusion, one grasps the mind with incorrect mental activity.

original: sems tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed bar gnas pa de dag la /
analyzed: sems tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed bar gnas pa de dag la /
translated: For those whose minds are engaged in incorrect mental activity,

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams las gang yang rung ba'i nyon mongs pa kun du spyod par 'gyur ro //🔽de dag gzhi de las lus dang ngag dang yid kyi 'dod chags las skyes pa'i las kyang mngon par 'du byed /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams las gang yang rung ba'i nyon mongs pa kun du spyod par 'gyur ro // de dag gzhi de las lus dang ngag dang yid kyi 'dod chags las skyes pa'i las kyang mngon par 'du byed /
translated: the afflictions of desire, hatred, and delusion are active.🔽From that basis, they create karma born of desire, hatred, and delusion,

original: zhes sdang las @81b skyes pa dang ; gti mug las skyes pa'i las kyang mngon par 'du byed do //
analyzed: zhes sdang las @81b skyes pa dang ; gti mug las skyes pa'i las kyang mngon par 'du byed do //
translated: and they create karma born of desire, hatred, and delusion.

original: las las kyang skye ba 'brel ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las las kyang skye ba 'brel ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: And birth arises from action alone.

original: de ltar na byis pa bag la nyal dang ldan pa mtshan mar 'dzin pa can /
analyzed: de ltar na byis pa bag la nyal dang ldan pa mtshan mar 'dzin pa can /
translated: Thus, for the childish who are endowed with latent tendencies, who apprehend signs,

original: dmigs pa la spyod pa de dag la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed ba kun 'byung ba las nyon mongs pa kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dmigs pa la spyod pa de dag la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed ba kun 'byung ba las nyon mongs pa kun 'byung ngo //
translated: and who practice with reference points, the arising of affliction occurs from the arising of incorrect mental activity.

original: nyon mongs pa kun 'byung ba las ni las kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa kun 'byung ba las ni las kun 'byung ngo //
translated: From the arising of affliction, the arising of action occurs.

original: las kun 'byung ba las ni skye ba kun 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las kun 'byung ba las ni skye ba kun 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From the arising of action, the arising of birth occurs.

original: byis pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa 'di thams cad kyang khams gcig yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ma shes pas rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa 'di thams cad kyang khams gcig yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ma shes pas rab tu 'jug go //
translated: All of these aspects of the affliction of affliction, action, and birth are set in motion by the childish due to their not knowing one thing, just as it is.

original: de yang ji lta bur yongs su btsal ba na de'i rgyu mtshan ma dmigs pa 'ga' yang mi mthong ba de ltar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang ji lta bur yongs su btsal ba na de'i rgyu mtshan ma dmigs pa 'ga' yang mi mthong ba de ltar blta bar bya'o //
translated: And that should be seen in such a way that, when it is investigated, one does not see any cause for it at all.

original: gang gi tshe rgyu mtshan nam dmigs pa mi mthong ba de'i tshe yang dag pa mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyu mtshan nam dmigs pa mi mthong ba de'i tshe yang dag pa mthong ba yin te /
translated: When one does not see a reason or objective support, then one sees reality.

original: de ltar na chos de dag de bzhin gshegs pa mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //🔽gang zhig de ltar med pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi dmigs pa ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / yod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gyur pa don dam pa'i bden pa mthong ba'i phyir gnyis ka bsal ba med pa dang / bzhag pa med pa mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du mngon par byang chub pa de ni gang zhig skyes pas cig shos gtan bral ba dang med par rtogs par 'gyur ba kho na mthong ba'i gegs kyi rnam pa 'di mtha'
analyzed: de ltar na chos de dag de bzhin gshegs pa mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so // gang zhig de ltar med pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi dmigs pa ma mthong ba'i phyir dang / yod pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gyur pa don dam pa'i bden pa mthong ba'i phyir gnyis ka bsal ba med pa dang / bzhag pa med pa mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du mngon par byang chub pa de ni gang zhig skyes pas cig shos gtan bral ba dang med par rtogs par 'gyur ba kho na mthong ba'i gegs kyi rnam pa 'di mtha'
translated: Thus, those phenomena are fully awakened to as the equality of the tathāgatas through the equality of suchness.

original: dag gi gnyen por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dag gi gnyen por rig par bya'o //
translated: One who, by not seeing an objective support that is a reason for nonexistence in that way and by seeing existence as it is, the reality of the ultimate truth, is free from both elimination and establishment, the pristine wisdom of equality, and is fully awakened to the equality of all phenomena, should know that this is the antidote to all the aspects of the obscurations that are seen, which are the causes of the realization of the complete absence and nonexistence of the other.

original: chos kyi sku 'thob pa'i rgyu rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba dang sgom pa'i lam de yang rgyas par ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su 'brangs te mdo ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku 'thob pa'i rgyu rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba dang sgom pa'i lam de yang rgyas par ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su 'brangs te mdo ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The cause of attaining the Dharma Body is the nonconceptual intuition that is the path of insight and the path of meditative development. That should be understood in detail according to the sutra, following the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: theg pa chen po'i chos dkon mchog de las phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs rin po che 'byung bas de'i rjes thogs su de'i dbang du byas nas tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos dkon mchog de las phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs rin po che 'byung bas de'i rjes thogs su de'i dbang du byas nas tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: The Jewel of the Community of irreversible Bodhisattvas is the source of the precious gems of the Great Vehicle Dharma. Therefore, immediately after that, a verse is made considering that.

original: sems de rang bzhin 'od gsal bas na nyon mongs ngo bo med gzigs pas //🔽gang dag 'gro kun bdag med @82a * //
analyzed: sems de rang bzhin 'od gsal bas na nyon mongs ngo bo med gzigs pas // gang dag 'gro kun bdag med @82a * //
translated: The mind is naturally luminous, so the afflictions are seen to be essentially nonexistent.

original: mtha' zhi yang dag rtogs nas thams cad la //
analyzed: mtha' zhi yang dag rtogs nas thams cad la //
translated: Those who realize the peace of the ultimate reality of the selflessness of all beings🔽and the complete purity of the world,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rjes zhugs gzigs ba sgrib pa med pa'i blo mnga' ba //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rjes zhugs gzigs ba sgrib pa med pa'i blo mnga' ba //
translated: the perfect Buddhas who have entered into that, whose vision is unobstructed,

original: sems can rnam dag mtha' yas yul can ye shes gzigs mnga' de la 'dud //
analyzed: sems can rnam dag mtha' yas yul can ye shes gzigs mnga' de la 'dud //
translated: I bow to them, whose wisdom vision has the infinite pure beings as its object.

original: 'dis ci bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis ci bstan zhe na /
translated: What is taught by this verse?

original: ji bzhin ji snyed nang gi ni //🔽ye shes gzhigs pa dag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ji bzhin ji snyed nang gi ni // ye shes gzhigs pa dag pa'i phyir //
translated: The inner is the analysis of the pristine wisdom of the way things are and the diversity of things.🔽🔽

original: blo ldan phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
analyzed: blo ldan phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
translated: The assembly of wise irreversible bodhisattvas

original: bla med yon tan dang ldan nyid //
analyzed: bla med yon tan dang ldan nyid //
translated: possesses the highest qualities🔽because of the purity of the vision of the transcendent wisdom that knows the mode and the varieties

original: 'dis ni mdor bsdus na ji lta ba bzhin yod pa dang ji snyed yod pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni mdor bsdus na ji lta ba bzhin yod pa dang ji snyed yod pa ste /
translated: of things, which is based on the ground of that wisdom.

original: rgyu gnyis kyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi gzigs pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs dkon mchog bla na med pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu gnyis kyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi gzigs pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs dkon mchog bla na med pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa nyid bstan to //
translated: In brief, this verse shows that the assembly of irreversible bodhisattvas possesses the qualities of the highest jewel because of the purity of their transcendent wisdom vision, which is due to two causes: the mode as it is and the varieties as many as there are.

original: 'gro ba zhi ba'i chos nyid du //
analyzed: 'gro ba zhi ba'i chos nyid du //
translated: Because they realize that the nature of beings is peace,

original: rtogs phyir ji lta nyid de yang //
analyzed: rtogs phyir ji lta nyid de yang //
translated: they also know the way things are

original: rang bzhin gyis ni yongs dag phyir //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni yongs dag phyir //
translated: because of their natural purity

original: nyon mongs gdod nas zad phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs gdod nas zad phyir ro //
translated: and because of the primordial exhaustion of defilement.

original: de la ji lta ba bzhin yong pa nyid ni chos dang gang zag ces bya ba'i 'gro ba thams cad kyi bdag med pa'i mtha' ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la ji lta ba bzhin yong pa nyid ni chos dang gang zag ces bya ba'i 'gro ba thams cad kyi bdag med pa'i mtha' ji lta ba bzhin rtogs pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: The way things really are should be understood as the realization of the way things really are, the nonexistence of a self of persons and phenomena, of all beings called “dharmas” and “persons.”

original: gtan du gzod ma nas zhi ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gang zag dang chos 'jig pa med pa'i tshul du rtogs pa de yang mdor bsdu na rgyu gnyis las skyes te /
analyzed: gtan du gzod ma nas zhi ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gang zag dang chos 'jig pa med pa'i tshul du rtogs pa de yang mdor bsdu na rgyu gnyis las skyes te /
translated: That realization that persons and phenomena are not destroyed, in the manner of their being primordially peace, is, in brief, born from two causes.

original: sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar mthong ba'i phyir dang / de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gdod ma nas zad cing 'gags par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar mthong ba'i phyir dang / de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gdod ma nas zad cing 'gags par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is born from seeing the mind as luminous by nature and from seeing that its secondary mental afflictions are primordially exhausted and ceased.

original: de la sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba gang yin pa dang / de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di gnyis ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems dag las gcig rgyu bas sems gnyis pa mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i tshul gyis zag pa med pa'i dbyings la mchog tu rtogs par dka' ba yin no
analyzed: de la sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba gang yin pa dang / de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di gnyis ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems dag las gcig rgyu bas sems gnyis pa mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i tshul gyis zag pa med pa'i dbyings la mchog tu rtogs par dka' ba yin no
translated: The mind that is luminous by nature and the so-called secondary afflictions—these two are difficult to realize as supreme in the uncontaminated realm, in the manner of one mind not connecting with another mind, whether it is a virtuous or non-virtuous mind.

original: // de'i phyir na bcom ldan 'das dge ba'i sems ni skad cig ma ste /
analyzed: // de'i phyir na bcom ldan 'das dge ba'i sems ni skad cig ma ste /
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, a virtuous mind is momentary.

original: nyon mongs pa dag gis nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dag gis nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not afflicted by afflictions.

original: mi dge ba'i sems ni skad cig ma ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sems ni skad cig ma ste /
translated: A non-virtuous mind is momentary.

original: sems de ni nyon mongs pa dag gis nyon mongs pa ma lags pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems de ni nyon mongs pa dag gis nyon mongs pa ma lags pa nyid do //
translated: That mind is not afflicted by afflictions.

original: bcom ldan 'das nyon mongs pa ni sems la mi reg la @82b sems nyon mongs pa yang ma lags na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyon mongs pa ni sems la mi reg la @82b sems nyon mongs pa yang ma lags na /
translated: Blessed One, if an affliction does not touch the mind and the mind is not afflicted by afflictions,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di la ji ltar reg pa'i chos can ma lags pa'i sems mun pas nyon mongs par 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di la ji ltar reg pa'i chos can ma lags pa'i sems mun pas nyon mongs par 'gyur /
translated: Blessed One, how can a mind that is not a dharma of contact be afflicted by darkness?

original: bcom ldan 'das nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni mchis la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni mchis la /
translated: Blessed One, there are secondary mental afflictions,

original: nye bar nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i sems ni ma mchis so //
analyzed: nye bar nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i sems ni ma mchis so //
translated: but there is no mind that is mentally afflicted.

original: bcom ldan 'das de lta lags mod kyi rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i sems nye bar nyon mongs pa'i don rtogs par dka'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de lta lags mod kyi rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i sems nye bar nyon mongs pa'i don rtogs par dka'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Blessed One, although that is so, the meaning of the naturally pure mind being mentally afflicted is difficult to understand.”

original: ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nas brtsams te rtogs par dka' ba'i bar rgyas par bstan pa ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //🔽shes bya mthar thug rtogs pa'i blos //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nas brtsams te rtogs par dka' ba'i bar rgyas par bstan pa ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin du rig par bya'o // shes bya mthar thug rtogs pa'i blos //
translated: The detailed explanation of the meaning of “difficult to understand,” beginning with “just as it is,” should be understood according to the sutra.🔽The knowledge that realizes the ultimate object of knowledge

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos nyid ni //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos nyid ni //
translated: is the reality of omniscience.

original: sems can thams cad la yod pa //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la yod pa //
translated: It exists in all sentient beings

original: mthong phyir ji snyed yod pa nyid //
analyzed: mthong phyir ji snyed yod pa nyid //
translated: because it is seen that all of them have the nature of omniscience.

original: de la ji snyed yod pa nyid ni shes bya'i dngos po mtha' dag mthar thug par rtogs pa la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyis sems can thams cad la tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gyur pa rnams la yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po
analyzed: de la ji snyed yod pa nyid ni shes bya'i dngos po mtha' dag mthar thug par rtogs pa la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyis sems can thams cad la tha na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gyur pa rnams la yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po
translated: The way things exist is the realization of the totality of knowable things.🔽

original: yod pa nyid mthong ba las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yod pa nyid mthong ba las rig par bya'o //
translated: The existence of things in their variety is to be understood from the supramundane wisdom that realizes the whole of reality, and from the fact that it sees the essence of the Tathagata in all beings, even in those who are animals.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mthong ba de yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po nyid las skye ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mthong ba de yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po nyid las skye ste /
translated: That vision of the bodhisattva arises on the first bodhisattva stage,

original: chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba'i don du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba'i don du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the universal of the ultimate realm is realized.

original: de ltar rtogs pa gang yin de //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa gang yin de //
translated: That realization is

original: so so rang shes mthong ba nyid //
analyzed: so so rang shes mthong ba nyid //
translated: the vision of the individual vehicle.

original: dri med dbyings la chags med dang // thogs med phyir de dag pa yin //
analyzed: dri med dbyings la chags med dang // thogs med phyir de dag pa yin //
translated: It is pure because it is unattached and unobstructed in the uncontaminated realm.

original: de ltar ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid dang ji snyed pa yod pa nyid kyi rnam pa 'dis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'phags pa rnams kyi gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa so so rang gis 'jig rten
analyzed: de ltar ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa nyid dang ji snyed pa yod pa nyid kyi rnam pa 'dis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni 'phags pa rnams kyi gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa so so rang gis 'jig rten
translated: Thus, the realization of the supramundane path by means of the aspects of the existence of the way things really are and the existence of things in their multiplicity is the supramundane path of the noble beings, which is not shared with others and is their own individual knowledge.🔽

original: las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi gzigs par 'dod do //
analyzed: las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi gzigs par 'dod do //
translated: Thus, the realization of the supramundane path by this aspect of the existence of the real nature and the existence of things in their variety is called the vision of the noble ones’ supramundane gnosis, which is not shared with ordinary beings.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na rgyu gnyis kyis na cig shos nyi tshe ba'i ye shes kyis mthong ba la ltos nas shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na rgyu gnyis kyis na cig shos nyi tshe ba'i ye shes kyis mthong ba la ltos nas shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes brjod do //
translated: In brief, it is said to be extremely pure in comparison with the vision of limited gnosis.

original: gnyis po gang dag gis she na /
analyzed: gnyis po gang dag gis she na /
translated: By what two causes?

original: chags pa med pa'i phyir dang / thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //🔽de la ji lta ba bzhin brjod pa nyid kyis sems can gyi khams rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i yul @83a * //
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i phyir dang / thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro // de la ji lta ba bzhin brjod pa nyid kyis sems can gyi khams rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i yul @83a * //
translated: Because it is free of attachment and because it is unobstructed.

original: can gyi phyir ni chags pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: can gyi phyir ni chags pa med pa yin la /
translated: In this regard, it is free of attachment because it is the subject that perceives the natural purity of the realm of sentient beings by means of the knowledge of things as they are.

original: ji snyed yod pa nyid kyis shes bya'i dngos po mtha' med pa'i yul can gyi phyir ni thogs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: ji snyed yod pa nyid kyis shes bya'i dngos po mtha' med pa'i yul can gyi phyir ni thogs pa med pa yin no //
translated: It is unobstructed because it has as its object the infinite things that are objects of knowledge, in so far as they exist.

original: ye shes gzigs pa dag pas na //
analyzed: ye shes gzigs pa dag pas na //
translated: Because of the purity of the vision of wisdom,

original: sangs rgyas ye shes bla med phyir //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ye shes bla med phyir //
translated: because of the unsurpassability of the Buddha's wisdom,

original: 'phags pa phyir mi ldog pa ni //
analyzed: 'phags pa phyir mi ldog pa ni //
translated: the noble one who is irreversible

original: lus can kun gyi skyabs yin no //
analyzed: lus can kun gyi skyabs yin no //
translated: is a refuge for all embodied beings.

original: de ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi gzigs pa de ni bla na med pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi gzigs pa rnam par dag pa dang nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi gzigs pa de ni bla na med pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi gzigs pa rnam par dag pa dang nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ram /
translated: Thus, the vision of the wisdom of the bodhisattvas who are on the irreversible stage is purified because it is close to the unsurpassable purified vision of the wisdom of the Tathagata, or

original: gang dang ldan pas phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad kyi skyabs su gyur pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang dang ldan pas phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad kyi skyabs su gyur pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: because, by possessing it, the irreversible bodhisattva becomes a refuge for all beings.

original: de las gzhan pa tshul khrims la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan rnams las bla na med pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa tshul khrims la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan rnams las bla na med pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that, in comparison with the other qualities of the bodhisattva such as morality, this wisdom is unsurpassable.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun gyi rjes thogs su nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dkon mchog ni ma smos te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun gyi rjes thogs su nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dkon mchog ni ma smos te /
translated: The Jewel of the Sangha of Hearers is not mentioned immediately after the Jewel of the Bodhisattva Sangha.

original: de mchod par 'os pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mchod par 'os pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The jewel of the śrāvaka Saṅgha is not mentioned immediately after the jewel of the bodhisattva Saṅgha because it is not worthy of worship.

original: mkhas pa byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos kyi yon tan gyi khyad par shes pa ni nam yang byang chub chen po'i bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi chogs rgya chen po rdzogs par byed pa /
analyzed: mkhas pa byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos kyi yon tan gyi khyad par shes pa ni nam yang byang chub chen po'i bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi chogs rgya chen po rdzogs par byed pa /
translated: The wise, who know the difference between the qualities of bodhisattvas and śrāvakas, always complete the vast accumulations of merit and wisdom for great enlightenment.

original: shes rab dang / snying rje'i dkyil 'khor can gzhal du med pa'i sems can gyi khams snang bar nye bar gnas pa /
analyzed: shes rab dang / snying rje'i dkyil 'khor can gzhal du med pa'i sems can gyi khams snang bar nye bar gnas pa /
translated: They are the ones who illuminate the immeasurable realms of sentient beings with the orb of their wisdom and compassion.

original: bla na med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i zla ba nya ba thob pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i lam du zhugs pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i zla ba nya ba thob pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i lam du zhugs pa /
translated: They are the ones who have entered the path that is similar to the path of the unsurpassable full moon of the tathāgatas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zla ba tshes pa dor nas nyi tshe ba'i ye shes kyi mthar thug pa skar ma'i gzugs ltar rang gi rgyud snang ba nye bar gnas pa'i nyan thos la nam yang phyag byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zla ba tshes pa dor nas nyi tshe ba'i ye shes kyi mthar thug pa skar ma'i gzugs ltar rang gi rgyud snang ba nye bar gnas pa'i nyan thos la nam yang phyag byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But the bodhisattva never bows down to the sravakas, whose own continuum appears as the ultimate of limited pristine wisdom, like the form of a star, after discarding the waxing moon.

original: gzhan la phan par byed pa'i bsam pa rnam par ma dag pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang dag par brten pa'i yon tan nyid kyis sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas kyang rjes su brtse ba med pa gzhan rgyas par byed pa dang mi ldan pa'i 'phags pa'i nyan thos zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa rnam par dag pa'i
analyzed: gzhan la phan par byed pa'i bsam pa rnam par ma dag pa'i phyir ro // yang dag par brten pa'i yon tan nyid kyis sems dang po bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpas kyang rjes su brtse ba med pa gzhan rgyas par byed pa dang mi ldan pa'i 'phags pa'i nyan thos zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa rnam par dag pa'i
translated: Because their intention to benefit others is impure.

original: mthar phyin par gyur pa yang zil gyis gnon na /
analyzed: mthar phyin par gyur pa yang zil gyis gnon na /
translated: Even the bodhisattva who has generated the first level of bodhichitta surpasses the arya sravakas who are devoid of compassion, who do not possess the qualities of benefiting others, and who have perfected the pure vows of untainted morality through the very quality of being perfectly supported.

original: @83b de las gzhan pa'i yon tan dbang bcu la sogs pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: @83b de las gzhan pa'i yon tan dbang bcu la sogs pa lta ci smos te /
translated: What need is there to mention the bodhisattvas who possess the other qualities, such as the ten masteries?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: gang zhig tshul khrims bdag don byed pas rnam rgyas shing //
analyzed: gang zhig tshul khrims bdag don byed pas rnam rgyas shing //
translated: those who perfect their morality for their own benefit

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba'i sems can rnams la brtse bral ba //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba'i sems can rnams la brtse bral ba //
translated: But they have no compassion for beings who have broken their ethics.

original: bdag nyid rgyas byed tshul khrims nor gyis rab dag pa /
analyzed: bdag nyid rgyas byed tshul khrims nor gyis rab dag pa /
translated: They are pure in the wealth of ethics that makes them grow.

original: 'phags pa de ni tshul khrims rnam par dag mi brjod //
analyzed: 'phags pa de ni tshul khrims rnam par dag mi brjod //
translated: The noble ones do not say that they are pure in ethics.

original: gang zhig gzhan la mchog tu snying rje bskyed nas ni //
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan la mchog tu snying rje bskyed nas ni //
translated: Those who, having generated supreme compassion for others,🔽Take up ethics properly and sustain others with ethics like fire, wind,

original: tshul khrims yang dag blangs pa byas te me rlung dang // chu dang sa bzhin gzhan dag nye bar 'tsho byed pa //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag blangs pa byas te me rlung dang // chu dang sa bzhin gzhan dag nye bar 'tsho byed pa //
translated: Water, and earth,

original: de ni khrims ldan gzhan ni de yi gzugs brnyan yin //🔽zhes bshad do //🔽de la don gang gis dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de ni khrims ldan gzhan ni de yi gzugs brnyan yin // zhes bshad do // de la don gang gis dbang du byas nas /
translated: They are ethical; the others are just their reflections.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis skyabs gsum rnam par gzhag pa mdzad ce na /🔽ston pa bstan pa slob don gyis //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis skyabs gsum rnam par gzhag pa mdzad ce na / ston pa bstan pa slob don gyis //
translated: What is the meaning in terms of which the Blessed One set forth the three refuges?

original: theg gsum pa dang byed gsum la //🔽mos pa rnams kyi dbang byas nas //
analyzed: theg gsum pa dang byed gsum la // mos pa rnams kyi dbang byas nas //
translated: The three vehicles and the three activities🔽Are for those devoted to the three educations🔽Of teacher, teaching, and student.

original: skyabs gsum rnam par gzhag pa yin //
analyzed: skyabs gsum rnam par gzhag pa yin //
translated: The three refuges are set forth🔽For those devoted to the three educations🔽Of teacher, teaching, and student.

original: ston pa'i yon tan bstan pa'i don du sangs rgyas kyi dngos po nyid don du gnyer bar zhugs pa byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i gang zag dag /
analyzed: ston pa'i yon tan bstan pa'i don du sangs rgyas kyi dngos po nyid don du gnyer bar zhugs pa byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i gang zag dag /
translated: For the sake of teaching the qualities of the Teacher, the Buddha, the Buddha is the refuge for those persons who are followers of the Bodhisattva Vehicle and who are engaged in seeking the state of a Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas la mchog tu bya ba byed par mos pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas sangs rgyas ni skyabs yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la mchog tu bya ba byed par mos pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas sangs rgyas ni skyabs yin te /
translated: For the sake of those who aspire to make the Buddha the supreme object of veneration, the Buddha is the refuge because he is the supreme of all humans.

original: rkang gnyis rnams kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zhing rnam par gzhag go //🔽ston pa'i yon tan bstan pa'i don du /🔽rang nyid rten 'brel gyi chos zab mo rjes su rtogs pa'i phyir zhugs pa /🔽rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i gang zag dang / chos la mchog tu bya ba byed par mos pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas chos ni skyabs yin te /

analyzed: thams cad gzigs @85b ba rnams kyi yul //
translated: The domain of the all-seers.

original: de yang rnam bzhi go rims bzhin //
analyzed: de yang rnam bzhi go rims bzhin //
translated: And it is fourfold, according to the four states.

original: rgyu bzhi yis ni bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: rgyu bzhi yis ni bsam mi khyab //
translated: It is inconceivable by the four causes.

original: de la dri ma dang bcas pa'i de bzhin nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i sbubs las ma grol ba'i khams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la dri ma dang bcas pa'i de bzhin nyid ni nyon mongs pa'i sbubs las ma grol ba'i khams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Therein, the defiled suchness is that which is called the essence of the tathiigatagarbha which is not free from the covering of the afflictions.

original: dri ma med pa'i de bzhin nyid ni de nyid sangs rgyas kyi sar gnas yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i de bzhin nyid ni de nyid sangs rgyas kyi sar gnas yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The undefiled suchness is that which is called the dharmakaya of the Tathagata, the transformation of the basis which is the state of Buddhahood.

original: dri ma med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yon tan ni gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku de nyid la yod pa 'jig rten las 'das pa stobs bcu la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yon tan ni gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku de nyid la yod pa 'jig rten las 'das pa stobs bcu la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: The undefiled qualities of the Buddha are those qualities of the Buddha such as the ten powers which exist in that dharmakaya of the Tathagata, the transformation of the basis, and which are supramundane.

original: rgyal ba'i mdzad pa ni stobs bcu la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi chos de nyid kyi so so rang gi bla na med pa'i phrin las te /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i mdzad pa ni stobs bcu la sogs pas sangs rgyas kyi chos de nyid kyi so so rang gi bla na med pa'i phrin las te /
translated: The activity of the Victorious One is the individual, unsurpassed activity of the Buddha Dharmas, through the ten powers and so forth.

original: gang zhig med par ma gyur zhing chad pa med la rgyun mchad pas byang chub sems dpa' lung bstan pa'i gtam rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig med par ma gyur zhing chad pa med la rgyun mchad pas byang chub sems dpa' lung bstan pa'i gtam rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: It is uninterrupted, because it is never absent, never interrupted, and never ceases. It is the uninterrupted story of the Bodhisattvas’ predictions.

original: gnas bzhi po 'di dag kyang go rims ji lta bzhin du rgyu bzhis bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid kyi phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gnas bzhi po 'di dag kyang go rims ji lta bzhin du rgyu bzhis bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid kyi phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: These four points are the domain of the wisdom of omniscience because they are inconceivable through four reasons, respectively.

original: bzhi po gang dag gis shes na //🔽dag dang nyon mongs dang ldan phyir //
analyzed: bzhi po gang dag gis shes na // dag dang nyon mongs dang ldan phyir //
translated: Through which four is it known?🔽Because it is endowed with purity and affliction,

original: kun nas nyon mongs med dag phyir //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs med dag phyir //
translated: because it is pure and free from affliction,

original: rnam par dbye ba med chos phyir //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba med chos phyir //
translated: because it is the Dharma without division,

original: lhun grub rnam par mi rtog phyir //
analyzed: lhun grub rnam par mi rtog phyir //
translated: and because it is spontaneous and nonconceptual.

original: de la dri ma dang bcas pa'i de bzhin rten nyid ni cig bcar dus gcig tu rnam par dag pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de la dri ma dang bcas pa'i de bzhin rten nyid ni cig bcar dus gcig tu rnam par dag pa yang yin la /
translated: The very support of the defiled thusness is the single, indivisible whole that is simultaneously completely pure.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa yang yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa yang yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is also thoroughly afflicted.

original: gnas 'di bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
analyzed: gnas 'di bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
translated: This topic is inconceivable,

original: zab mo'i chos kyi tshul la mos pa rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang spyod yul du ma gyur pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zab mo'i chos kyi tshul la mos pa rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang spyod yul du ma gyur pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the domain of the bodhisattvas who have the aspiration for the way of the profound Dharma, but is not the domain of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: gang gi phyir lha mo chos 'di gnyis ni rtogs par dka' ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lha mo chos 'di gnyis ni rtogs par dka' ba ste /
translated: Because, goddess, these two dharmas are difficult to understand:

original: sems rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa rtogs par dka' ba dang / sems de nyid kyi nye bar nyon mongs pa rtogs par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: sems rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa rtogs par dka' ba dang / sems de nyid kyi nye bar nyon mongs pa rtogs par dka' ba'o //
translated: the mind that is pure by nature is difficult to understand, and the affliction of that very mind is difficult to understand.

original: lha mo chos 'di gnyis nyan par byed pa ni khyod dam yang na chos chen po dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams yin no //🔽lha mo lhag ma nyan thos dang rang @86a * //
analyzed: lha mo chos 'di gnyis nyan par byed pa ni khyod dam yang na chos chen po dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams yin no // lha mo lhag ma nyan thos dang rang @86a * //
translated: Goddess, these two dharmas are heard by you or by the bodhisattvas who have the great Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyis ni chos 'di gnyis de bzhin gshegs pa la dad pas rtogs par bya ba nyid do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis ni chos 'di gnyis de bzhin gshegs pa la dad pas rtogs par bya ba nyid do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Goddess, the remainder of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas understand these two dharmas by having faith in the Tathāgata.

original: de la dri ma med pa'i de bzhin nyid ni sngar dri mas kun nas nyon mongs par ma gyur pa phyis rnam par dag par gyur pa'i phyir gnas 'di bsam gyis mi khyab po //
analyzed: de la dri ma med pa'i de bzhin nyid ni sngar dri mas kun nas nyon mongs par ma gyur pa phyis rnam par dag par gyur pa'i phyir gnas 'di bsam gyis mi khyab po //
translated: The stainlessness of suchness is inconceivable, because it was not previously defiled by the afflictions and later becomes pure.

original: gang gi phyir sems ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: The mind is luminous by nature.

original: de ni de kho na bzhin shes so //
analyzed: de ni de kho na bzhin shes so //
translated: It is known just as it is.

original: des na skad cig ma gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na skad cig ma gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment through the wisdom of a single moment.

original: de la dri ma med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yon tan ni gcig tu kun nas nyon mongs pa so so'i skye bo'i sa la yang rnam pas dbyer med pa'i chos nyid snga phyir khyad par med pa yod pa'i phyir gnas 'di bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
analyzed: de la dri ma med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yon tan ni gcig tu kun nas nyon mongs pa so so'i skye bo'i sa la yang rnam pas dbyer med pa'i chos nyid snga phyir khyad par med pa yod pa'i phyir gnas 'di bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
translated: The stainlessness of the qualities of a buddha is inconceivable, because the reality that is undifferentiated in terms of aspects exists without distinction before and after, even on the stage of ordinary beings who are completely afflicted.

original: gang gi phyir gang la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mtha' dag rjes su ma zhugs pa'i sems can de ni sems can gyi ris na 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mtha' dag rjes su ma zhugs pa'i sems can de ni sems can gyi ris na 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Because there is not a single being in the realms of sentient beings in whom the omniscience of the tathāgatas has not been operating.

original: 'on kyang 'du shes kyi 'dzin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mi mngon no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'du shes kyi 'dzin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mi mngon no //
translated: However, the omniscience of the tathāgatas is not evident due to the grasping of conceptualization.

original: 'du shes kyi 'dzin pa dang bral ba las ni /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi 'dzin pa dang bral ba las ni /
translated: From the freedom from the grasping of conceptualization

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rang byung gi ye shes thogs pa med par rab tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rang byung gi ye shes thogs pa med par rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: the knowledge of the omniscience of the tathāgatas, the self-arisen knowledge, arises without obstruction.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste /🔽dper na stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad dang mnyam pa'i dar yug chen po gcig yod par gyur la /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras 'di lta ste / dper na stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad dang mnyam pa'i dar yug chen po gcig yod par gyur la /
translated: “O son of the victors, it is like this:🔽imagine a great cloth that is the same size as the trichiliocosm.

original: dar yug chen po de la yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rdzogs par bris par gyur te /
analyzed: dar yug chen po de la yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rdzogs par bris par gyur te /
translated: On that great cloth, the entire trichiliocosm would be depicted,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: as follows:

original: khor yug chen po'i tshad du ni khor yug chen po bris /
analyzed: khor yug chen po'i tshad du ni khor yug chen po bris /
translated: the great surrounding mountains would be depicted as the great surrounding mountains,

original: sa chen po'i tshad du ni sa chen po /
analyzed: sa chen po'i tshad du ni sa chen po /
translated: The size of the great earth is the size of the great earth.

original: stong gnyis pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad du ni stong gnyis pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams /
analyzed: stong gnyis pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad du ni stong gnyis pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams /
translated: The size of a world system of two-thousand worlds is the size of a world system of two-thousand worlds.

original: stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad du ni stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams /
analyzed: stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad du ni stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams /
translated: The size of a world system of one-thousand worlds is the size of a world system of one-thousand worlds.

original: gling bzhi'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad du ni gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams /
analyzed: gling bzhi'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad du ni gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams /
translated: The size of a world system of four continents is the size of a world system of four continents.

original: rgya mtsho chen po'i tshad du ni rgya mtsho chen po /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po'i tshad du ni rgya mtsho chen po /
translated: The size of the great ocean is the size of the great ocean.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi tshad du ni 'dzam bu'i gling /🔽shar gyi lus 'phags kyi gling gi tshang du ni shar gyi @86b las 'phags kyi gling /🔽nub kyi ba lang spyod kyi gling gi tshad du ni nub kyi ba lang spyod kyi gling /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi tshad du ni 'dzam bu'i gling / shar gyi lus 'phags kyi gling gi tshang du ni shar gyi @86b las 'phags kyi gling / nub kyi ba lang spyod kyi gling gi tshad du ni nub kyi ba lang spyod kyi gling /
translated: The size of Jambudvīpa is the size of Jambudvīpa.🔽The size of Videha in the east is the size of Videha in the east.🔽The size of Godānīya in the west is the size of Godānīya in the west.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi gling gi tshad du ni byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi gling /🔽re rab kyi tshad du ni ra rib /
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi gling gi tshad du ni byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi gling /🔽re rab kyi tshad du ni ra rib /
translated: The size of Kuru in the north is the size of Kuru in the north.🔽The size of a sesame seed is the size of a sesame seed.

original: sa la spyod pa'i lha'i gzhal yas khang gi tshad du ni sa la spyod pa'i lha'i gzhal yas khang /
analyzed: sa la spyod pa'i lha'i gzhal yas khang gi tshad du ni sa la spyod pa'i lha'i gzhal yas khang /
translated: The celestial palaces of the gods who live on the earth are drawn to the size of the celestial palaces of the gods who live on the earth.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i gzhal yas khang gi tshad du ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i gzhal yas khang /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i gzhal yas khang gi tshad du ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i gzhal yas khang /
translated: The celestial palaces of the gods who live in the desire realm are drawn to the size of the celestial palaces of the gods who live in the desire realm.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i gzhal yas khang gi tshad du ni gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i gzhal yas khang bris so //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i gzhal yas khang gi tshad du ni gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i gzhal yas khang bris so //
translated: The celestial palaces of the gods who live in the form realm are drawn to the size of the celestial palaces of the gods who live in the form realm.

original: dar yug chen po de yang chu zheng stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad tsam du gyur la /
analyzed: dar yug chen po de yang chu zheng stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi tshad tsam du gyur la /
translated: The great cloth is the size of a great trichiliocosm.

original: dar yug chen po de yang rdul phra rab kyi rdul gcig tu bcug par gyur to //
analyzed: dar yug chen po de yang rdul phra rab kyi rdul gcig tu bcug par gyur to //
translated: The great cloth is placed in a single atom.

original: ji ltar rdul phra rab kyi rdul gcig tu dar yug chen po de bcug pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab kyi rdul ma lus pa rnams su de'i tshad kyi dar yug chen po de nang du bcug par gyur to //
analyzed: ji ltar rdul phra rab kyi rdul gcig tu dar yug chen po de bcug pa de bzhin du rdul phra rab kyi rdul ma lus pa rnams su de'i tshad kyi dar yug chen po de nang du bcug par gyur to //
translated: Just as the great cloth is placed in a single atom, so too the great cloth of that size is placed inside all the remaining atoms.

original: de nas mkhas pa mdzangs pa gsal ba yid gzhungs pa der nye bar zhugs pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu 'ga' zhig skyes te /
analyzed: de nas mkhas pa mdzangs pa gsal ba yid gzhungs pa der nye bar zhugs pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu 'ga' zhig skyes te /
translated: Then, a wise, intelligent, clear-minded, and sharp-witted person appears who is engaged in the conduct of approaching the cloth.

original: de'i mig lha'i mig tu gyur cing kun tu yongs su dag pa 'od gsal bar gyur pa zhig la des lha'i mig gis rnam par bltas te /
analyzed: de'i mig lha'i mig tu gyur cing kun tu yongs su dag pa 'od gsal bar gyur pa zhig la des lha'i mig gis rnam par bltas te /
translated: With the divine eye, the eye of a god, that person looks all around with a completely pure and radiant eye.

original: 'di lta bur gyur pa'i dar yug chen po 'di rdul phra rab kyi rdul chung du 'di nyid la gnas te /
analyzed: 'di lta bur gyur pa'i dar yug chen po 'di rdul phra rab kyi rdul chung du 'di nyid la gnas te /
translated: With the divine eye, he sees that the great cloth is located on this very small particle of dust.

original: sems can 'ga' la yang nye bar mkho bar ma gyur to //
analyzed: sems can 'ga' la yang nye bar mkho bar ma gyur to //
translated: It has not been of any use to any sentient being.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks, ‘Alas!

original: kye ma gang bdag gi brtson pa chen po'i stobs dang mthus rdul phra rab kyi rdul 'di rdo rjes phye ste /
analyzed: kye ma gang bdag gi brtson pa chen po'i stobs dang mthus rdul phra rab kyi rdul 'di rdo rjes phye ste /
translated: By the power of my great diligence, I will split this particle of dust with a vajra

original: dar yug chen po 'di 'gro ba thams cad kyi nye bar 'tsho bar bya'o snyam pas /
analyzed: dar yug chen po 'di 'gro ba thams cad kyi nye bar 'tsho bar bya'o snyam pas /
translated: and make this great cloth a source of livelihood for all beings.’

original: des brtson pa chen po'i stobs kyi mthus bskyed de /
analyzed: des brtson pa chen po'i stobs kyi mthus bskyed de /
translated: With the power of great diligence, he generates

original: rdo rje phra mos rdul phra rab kyi rdul de phye nas bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du dar yug chen po de 'gro ba mtha' dag la nye bar 'tsho bar byed cing /
analyzed: rdo rje phra mos rdul phra rab kyi rdul de phye nas bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du dar yug chen po de 'gro ba mtha' dag la nye bar 'tsho bar byed cing /
translated: The subtle vajra splits the particles of the subtle dust, and the great cloth is used to sustain all beings in accordance with their wishes.

original: gcig la ji lta ba de bzhin du rdul phra rab lus pa med pa mtha' dag las de kho na bzhin byed do //🔽kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes tshad med pa'i ye shes sems can thams cad @87a * //
analyzed: gcig la ji lta ba de bzhin du rdul phra rab lus pa med pa mtha' dag las de kho na bzhin byed do // kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes tshad med pa'i ye shes sems can thams cad @87a * //
translated: Just as it is for one, it is the same for all the remaining subtle particles.

original: nye bar 'tsho ba'i ye shes kyang sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyud la mtshang ba med par rjes su zhugs te /
analyzed: nye bar 'tsho ba'i ye shes kyang sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgyud la mtshang ba med par rjes su zhugs te /
translated: “O son of the victors, in the same way, the wisdom of the tathāgatas, the wisdom that sustains all sentient beings, is faultlessly present in the mind streams of all sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi sems kyi rgyud de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang 'dra bar tshad med do //
analyzed: sems can gyi sems kyi rgyud de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang 'dra bar tshad med do //
translated: And those mind streams of sentient beings are immeasurable, just like the wisdom of the tathāgatas.

original: de lta mod kyi 'du shes kyi 'dzin pas bcings pa'i byis pa rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mi shes rab tu mi shes shing nyams su mi myong /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'du shes kyi 'dzin pas bcings pa'i byis pa rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mi shes rab tu mi shes shing nyams su mi myong /
translated: Nevertheless, childish beings who are bound by the grasping of perception do not know the wisdom of the tathagatas, do not fully know it, and do not experience it.

original: mngon du mi byed do //
analyzed: mngon du mi byed do //
translated: They do not actualize it.

original: des na de bzhin gshegs pa chags pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyis chos kyi dbyings sems can gyi gnas thams cad la rnam par gzigs nas /
analyzed: des na de bzhin gshegs pa chags pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyis chos kyi dbyings sems can gyi gnas thams cad la rnam par gzigs nas /
translated: Therefore, the tathagatas, with the wisdom of the tathagatas that is free from attachment, see the dharmadhatu, the abode of all sentient beings,

original: slob dpon gyi 'du shes su gyur te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi 'du shes su gyur te /
translated: and they become teachers.

original: kye ma ma la sems can 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rjes su zhugs pa dag ste /
analyzed: kye ma ma la sems can 'di dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mi shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes rjes su zhugs pa dag ste /
translated: “Alas! These sentient beings do not know the wisdom of the tathagatas as it is, and they do not follow the wisdom of the tathagatas.

original: gang yang ngas sems can 'di dag la 'phags pa'i lam nye par bstan pas 'du shes kyis byas ba'i 'ching ba thams cad bsal phar byas te /
analyzed: gang yang ngas sems can 'di dag la 'phags pa'i lam nye par bstan pas 'du shes kyis byas ba'i 'ching ba thams cad bsal phar byas te /
translated: I will teach these sentient beings the nearby noble path so that they may remove all the bonds created by perception.

original: ji ltar rang nyid 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi stobs bskyed pas ye shes kyi mdud pa chen po bsal nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes so sor mngon par shes shing /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang mnyam pa nyid rjes su thob pa bzhin du de dag la de bzhin gshegs pa'i lam bstan pas 'du shes kyis byas pa'i 'ching ba thams cad log par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar rang nyid 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi stobs bskyed pas ye shes kyi mdud pa chen po bsal nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes so sor mngon par shes shing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang mnyam pa nyid rjes su thob pa bzhin du de dag la de bzhin gshegs pa'i lam bstan pas 'du shes kyis byas pa'i 'ching ba thams cad log par byed do //
translated: Just as they have themselves, through the power of the wisdom of the noble ones, removed the great knots of wisdom and have individually realized the wisdom of the Tathāgata,🔽and have attained the state of equality with the wisdom of the Tathāgata, in the same way, by teaching them the path of the Tathāgata, they cause them to turn away from all the bonds created by perceptions.

original: 'du shes kyis byas pa'i 'ching ba thams cad log pa dag la ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes tshad med pa de 'gro ba mtha' dag gi nye bar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'du shes kyis byas pa'i 'ching ba thams cad log pa dag la ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes tshad med pa de 'gro ba mtha' dag gi nye bar 'tsho bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: For those who have turned away from all the bonds created by perceptions, that immeasurable wisdom of the Tathāgata becomes a support for the entire world.

original: de la rgyal ba'i mdzad pa ni cig car thams cad la dus thams cad du lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par bsam ba ji lta ba dang / gdul bya ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams la ma tshang ba med cing rjes su mthun bar 'jug pa'i phyir gnas 'di bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
analyzed: de la rgyal ba'i mdzad pa ni cig car thams cad la dus thams cad du lhun gyis grub cing rnam par mi rtog par bsam ba ji lta ba dang / gdul bya ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams la ma tshang ba med cing rjes su mthun bar 'jug pa'i phyir gnas 'di bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
translated: The deeds of the Victorious One are spontaneously accomplished, nonconceptual, and in accordance with the wishes of beings and the way they are to be trained. They are therefore inconceivable.

original: gang gi phyir sems can rnams gzhug pa'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes tshad med pa yin yang mdor bsdus pa tsam gyi sgo nas tshad dang ldan par bstan mod kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can rnams gzhug pa'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes tshad med pa yin yang mdor bsdus pa tsam gyi sgo nas tshad dang ldan par bstan mod kyi /
translated: Although the wisdom of the tathagatas is immeasurable, it is taught as being measurable in terms of a brief summary in order to introduce it to sentient beings.

original: rigs @87b kyi bu 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa tshad med pa 'jig rten thams cad kyis shes par bya ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rigs @87b kyi bu 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa tshad med pa 'jig rten thams cad kyis shes par bya ba ma yin pa /
translated: Son of noble family, the true activities of the tathagatas are inconceivable, immeasurable, and unknowable to the entire world.

original: yi ge brjod du med pa /
analyzed: yi ge brjod du med pa /
translated: They are inexpressible in words.

original: gzhan gyis sgrub par dka' ba /
analyzed: gzhan gyis sgrub par dka' ba /
translated: They are difficult for others to accomplish.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du gnas pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du gnas pa /
translated: They abide in all buddha realms.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid rjes su thob pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid rjes su thob pa /
translated: They have attained the state of equality with all buddhas.

original: 'bad rtsol dang bya ba thams cad las 'das pa /
analyzed: 'bad rtsol dang bya ba thams cad las 'das pa /
translated: They are beyond all effort and activity.

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa med pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa med pa /
translated: They are nonconceptual, being equal to space.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi bya ba nyid kyi tha dad du dbyer med pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi bya ba nyid kyi tha dad du dbyer med pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: They are indivisible, being the activity of the realm of phenomena.

original: nor bu bee d'u rya rnam par dag pa'i dper mdzad nas /
analyzed: nor bu bee d'u rya rnam par dag pa'i dper mdzad nas /
translated: The sutra then gives the analogy of a pure beryl gem,

original: rgyas par bstan te /🔽rigs kyi bu rnam grangs 'dis 'di ltar rigs par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyas par bstan te / rigs kyi bu rnam grangs 'dis 'di ltar rigs par bya ste /
translated: and teaches in detail.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa mnyam pa nyid rjes su thob pa thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med pa dus gsum dang rjes su 'brel pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa mnyam pa nyid rjes su thob pa thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med pa dus gsum dang rjes su 'brel pa /
translated: “Son of noble family, by this enumeration you should understand that the activity of the thus-gone ones is inconceivable, that they have attained the state of equality, that they are irreproachable in all respects, that they are connected with the three times,

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung mi 'chad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung mi 'chad par byed pa'o //
translated: and that they ensure the continuity of the three jewels.”

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las gang la rab tu zhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nam mkha'i rang bzhin yang mi 'dor la /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las gang la rab tu zhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku nam mkha'i rang bzhin yang mi 'dor la /
translated: The body of the Tathagata, which is the nature of space, does not abandon the inconceivable activity of the Tathagata in which it is engaged.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du yang kun tu ston to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du yang kun tu ston to //
translated: And it manifests in all buddha-fields.

original: gsung brjod du med pa'i chos nyid kyang mi 'dor la /
analyzed: gsung brjod du med pa'i chos nyid kyang mi 'dor la /
translated: It does not abandon the inexpressible reality of speech.

original: sgra rnam par rig pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams la chos kyang ston to //
analyzed: sgra rnam par rig pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams la chos kyang ston to //
translated: And it teaches the Dharma to sentient beings in accordance with the awareness of sound.

original: sems kyi dmigs pa thams cad dang yang bral la /
analyzed: sems kyi dmigs pa thams cad dang yang bral la /
translated: It is free from all mental supports.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa dang bsam pa yang rab tu shes so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa dang bsam pa yang rab tu shes so zhes gsungs so //
translated: And it fully knows the mental behavior and thoughts of all sentient beings.

original: rtogs bya rtogs pa de yi ni //
analyzed: rtogs bya rtogs pa de yi ni //
translated: The object of realization, the realization,

original: yan lag rtogs par byed phyir te //
analyzed: yan lag rtogs par byed phyir te //
translated: and the branches of that realization,

original: go rims ji bzhin gnas gcig ste //
analyzed: go rims ji bzhin gnas gcig ste //
translated: are the single basis,

original: dag rgyu gsum ni rkyen yin no //
analyzed: dag rgyu gsum ni rkyen yin no //
translated: and the three causes are the conditions.

original: don gyi gnas bzhin po 'di dag las kyang shes bya thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir dang po ni rtogs par bya ba'i gnas su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: don gyi gnas bzhin po 'di dag las kyang shes bya thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir dang po ni rtogs par bya ba'i gnas su blta bar bya'o //
translated: Since all objects of knowledge are included in these four topics, the first is to be regarded as the topic to be understood.

original: de'i rjes su rtogs pa ni rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir gnyis pa byang chub kyi gnas so //
analyzed: de'i rjes su rtogs pa ni rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir gnyis pa byang chub kyi gnas so //
translated: Since understanding comes after that, the second is the topic of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag tu gyur pa ni sangs rgyas kyi yon tan yin pa'i phyir gsum pa byang chub kyi yan lag gi gnas so //🔽byang @88a * //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag tu gyur pa ni sangs rgyas kyi yon tan yin pa'i phyir gsum pa byang chub kyi yan lag gi gnas so // byang @88a * //
translated: Since the qualities of a Buddha are the branches of enlightenment, the third is the topic of the branches of enlightenment.

original: chub kyi yan lag rnams nyid kyis gzhan dag rtogs par byed pa'i phyir bzhi pa rtogs par byed pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: chub kyi yan lag rnams nyid kyis gzhan dag rtogs par byed pa'i phyir bzhi pa rtogs par byed pa'i gnas so //
translated: Since the branches of enlightenment themselves cause others to understand, the fourth is the topic of causing understanding.

original: de ltar gnas bzhi po 'di dbang du byas te rgyu dang rkyen gyi dngos pos dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gnas bzhi po 'di dbang du byas te rgyu dang rkyen gyi dngos pos dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand that the lineage of the Three Jewels is established by the principle of cause and effect with reference to these four topics.

original: de la gnas bzhi po 'di dag las dang po ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyis bon yin pa'i phyir so so rang nyid tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i gnas kyis de rnam par dag pa la brten nas dkon mchog gsum gyi rgyur rtogs par byed par
analyzed: de la gnas bzhi po 'di dag las dang po ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyis bon yin pa'i phyir so so rang nyid tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i gnas kyis de rnam par dag pa la brten nas dkon mchog gsum gyi rgyur rtogs par byed par
translated: From among these four topics, the first is the cause of the three jewels because it is the seed of supramundane dharmas. It should be understood to be the cause of the three jewels in dependence on its purity, since it is the basis for properly attending to oneself.

original: bya ste / de ltar gnas gcig ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: bya ste / de ltar gnas gcig ni rgyu yin no //
translated: Thus one topic is the cause.

original: ji ltar gsum rkyen yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gsum rkyen yin zhe na /
translated: How are the other three conditions?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas stobs bcu la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las rnam pa sum cu rtsa gnyis mdzad pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon bar rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas stobs bcu la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las rnam pa sum cu rtsa gnyis mdzad pa na /
translated: When the tathāgata, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment, performs the thirty two deeds of a tathāgata through the buddhadharmas such as the ten powers,

analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra la brten nas de rnam par dag pa la brten nas dkon mchog 'byung ba'i rkyen du rtogs par bya ste /

original: de ltar gsum po 'di ni rkyen yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gsum po 'di ni rkyen yin no //
translated: Thus these three are conditions.

original: 'di phan chad gzhung lhag mas gnas bzhi po 'di dag nyid kyis mthar gyis rnam par dbye ba rgyas par ston par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di phan chad gzhung lhag mas gnas bzhi po 'di dag nyid kyis mthar gyis rnam par dbye ba rgyas par ston par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the remaining passages of the text extensively classify these four topics.

original: de la dri ma dang bcas pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas sems can thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can no zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de don gang gi yin zhe na /🔽rdzogs sangs sku ni 'phro phyir dang // de bzhin nyid dbyer med phyir dang // rigs yod phyir na lus can kun //

original: rtag tu sangs rgyas snying po can //
analyzed: rtag tu sangs rgyas snying po can //
translated: All embodied beings are always possessed of the essence of the Buddha, because the body of the perfect Buddha pervades, because suchness is undifferentiated, and because of the presence of the lineage.

translated: First, the Dharma Body of the Tathāgata is to be understood as similar to a wish-granting gem, in terms of its essence, which is the nature of power, such as the accomplishment of the aims of beings, etc.,🔽in terms of its own characteristic.🔽Suchness is to be understood as similar to space, in terms of its own characteristic, which is the nature of non-difference,

original: de bzhin nyid la ni gzhan du ma yin pa nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo'i rang gi mtshan nyid las brtsams nas nam mkha' dang chos mthun pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la ni gzhan du ma yin pa nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo'i rang gi mtshan nyid las brtsams nas nam mkha' dang chos mthun pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: in terms of its own essence.🔽The Tathāgata’s clan is to be understood as similar to water, in terms of its own essence, which is moistened by compassion for sentient beings,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la ni sems can la snying brtse bas brlan pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid las brtsams nas chu dang chos mthun pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la ni sems can la snying brtse bas brlan pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid las brtsams nas chu dang chos mthun pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: in terms of its own characteristic.

original: 'dir thams cad kyang rtag tu rang bzhin gyis shin tu nye bar nyon mongs pa med pa rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid las brtsams nas de nyid yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang / nam mkha' dang chu rnam bar dag pa'i yon tan dang /🔽chos mthun par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir thams cad kyang rtag tu rang bzhin gyis shin tu nye bar nyon mongs pa med pa rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid las brtsams nas de nyid yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang / nam mkha' dang chu rnam bar dag pa'i yon tan dang / chos mthun par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, all of them are always naturally free of the afflictions, and beginning from the general characteristic of natural purity, they are to be known as being similar to a wish fulfilling gem, space, and the pure qualities of water.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa phyed 'og mas ci bstan zhe na /
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa phyed 'og mas ci bstan zhe na /
translated: What is taught by the second half of the verse?

original: chos la khong khro bdag lta dang // 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs dang // sems can don la ltos med pa //
analyzed: chos la khong khro bdag lta dang // 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs dang // sems can don la ltos med pa //
translated: Aversion to the Dharma, the view of self, fear of the sufferings of cyclic existence, and disregard for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: 'dod chen mu stegs nyan thos dang // rang byung rnams kyi sgrib rnam bzhin //🔽dag rgyu lhag par mos pa la //
analyzed: 'dod chen mu stegs nyan thos dang // rang byung rnams kyi sgrib rnam bzhin // dag rgyu lhag par mos pa la //
translated: These are the four obscurations of the bodhisattvas, the pratyekabuddhas, the śrāvakas, and the self arisen ones.

original: sogs pa'i chos ni rnam bzhi nyid //
analyzed: sogs pa'i chos ni rnam bzhi nyid //
translated: The cause of purification is the fourfold Dharma of superior aspiration and so on.

original: mdor bsdu na sems can gyi tshogs na sems can gyi rnam pa 'di gsum yod de /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na sems can gyi tshogs na sems can gyi rnam pa 'di gsum yod de /
translated: In brief, there are three types of sentient beings in the assembly of sentient beings.

original: srid pa 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang bral bar 'dod pa dang / de gnyis ka mngon par mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang bral bar 'dod pa dang / de gnyis ka mngon par mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: One who desires existence, one who desires to be free from existence, and one who does not desire either of those.

original: de la srid pa 'dod pa ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la srid pa 'dod pa ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: One who desires existence should be understood as twofold:

original: thar pa'i lam dang zhe 'gras pa yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i rigs can gyi sems can 'khor ba nyid 'dod kyi /
analyzed: thar pa'i lam dang zhe 'gras pa yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i rigs can gyi sems can 'khor ba nyid 'dod kyi /
translated: those who are hostile to the path of liberation, who are of the class of those not destined for nirvana, and who desire only cyclic existence;

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma yin pa gang dag yin pa dang / der nges par lhung ba chos 'di pa nyid de dag las kha cig theg pa chen po'i chos la sdang ba ste /🔽gang gi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma yin pa gang dag yin pa dang / der nges par lhung ba chos 'di pa nyid de dag las kha cig theg pa chen po'i chos la sdang ba ste / gang gi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: and those who have fallen into that, who are Buddhists, but who are hostile to the teachings of the Mahayana.🔽With regard to them, the Lord said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nga ni de dag gi ston pa ma yin la //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nga ni de dag gi ston pa ma yin la //
translated: I am not their teacher,

original: de dag kyang nga'i nyan thos ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang nga'i nyan thos ma yin no //
translated: and they are not my disciples.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de dag ni mun pa bas kyang ches mun pa chen por 'gro ba mun pa chen po dang ldan pa'o zhes pa smra'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de dag ni mun pa bas kyang ches mun pa chen por 'gro ba mun pa chen po dang ldan pa'o zhes pa smra'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: O Śāriputra, they go to a darkness greater than that, to a great darkness.

original: de la srid pa dang bral bar 'dod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la srid pa dang bral bar 'dod pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those who wish to be free from existence are of two types:

original: thabs ma yin pa la zhugs pa dang / thabs @89b la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: thabs ma yin pa la zhugs pa dang / thabs @89b la zhugs pa'o //
translated: those who engage in what is not a method and those who engage in a method.

original: de la thabs ma yin pa la zhugs pa la yang rnam pa gsum ste /🔽'di las phyi rol du gyur pa tsa ra ka dang / kun tu rgyu dang / gcer bu pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa du ma'i mu stegs pa mang po dang / de dang mthun par spyod pa chos 'di pa nyid dad pa yod kyang ;
analyzed: de la thabs ma yin pa la zhugs pa la yang rnam pa gsum ste / 'di las phyi rol du gyur pa tsa ra ka dang / kun tu rgyu dang / gcer bu pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa du ma'i mu stegs pa mang po dang / de dang mthun par spyod pa chos 'di pa nyid dad pa yod kyang ;
translated: Those who engage in what is not a method are of three types:

original: nges par gzung dka' ba'i lta ba 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: nges par gzung dka' ba'i lta ba 'dzin pa ste /
translated: those who are outside this teaching, such as Carakas, Parivrajakas, Nirgranthas, and many other types of tirthikas, and those who practice in accordance with them, who are Buddhists but hold views that are difficult to correct, even though they have faith in this teaching.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What are they?

original: don dam pa la mi mos pa gang zag tu lta ba ste /
analyzed: don dam pa la mi mos pa gang zag tu lta ba ste /
translated: They are those who do not aspire to the ultimate and who hold the view of the person,

original: gang la bcom ldan 'das kyis stong pa nyid la mos pa med pa ni mu stegs pa dag dang khyad par med pa yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal can stong ba nyid du lta ba ste /
analyzed: gang la bcom ldan 'das kyis stong pa nyid la mos pa med pa ni mu stegs pa dag dang khyad par med pa yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal can stong ba nyid du lta ba ste /
translated: about whom the Bhagavān said, “Those who do not aspire to emptiness are not different from the tirthikas,” and those who are arrogant and hold the view of emptiness.

original: 'di la stong pa nyid du lta ba gang dag de'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo la yang stong pa nyid du lta par 'gyur ba gang gi dbang du mdzad nas /🔽'od srungs gang zag tu lta ba ri rab tsam ni bla'i /
analyzed: 'di la stong pa nyid du lta ba gang dag de'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo la yang stong pa nyid du lta par 'gyur ba gang gi dbang du mdzad nas / 'od srungs gang zag tu lta ba ri rab tsam ni bla'i /
translated: Here, those who view emptiness as a view are also those who view emptiness as a door of liberation.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can ston pa nyid du lta ba ni de lta ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can ston pa nyid du lta ba ni de lta ma yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: With respect to them, it is said, KaSyapa, it is better to have the view of a person as large as Mount Meru than to have pride in one's view of the teacher as empty.

original: de la thabs la zhugs pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la thabs la zhugs pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those who enter the method are also of two types:

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang mthun pa yang dag par nges pa nyid du zhugs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang mthun pa yang dag par nges pa nyid du zhugs pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang mthun pa'o //
translated: those who enter into the certainty that accords with the sravaka vehicle and those who accord with the pratyekabuddha vehicle.

original: de gnyi ga mngon par mi 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: de gnyi ga mngon par mi 'dod pa ni /
