translated: Those who do not aspire to either of those

original: theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa mchog tu dbang po rnon po'i sems can te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa mchog tu dbang po rnon po'i sems can te /
translated: are the supreme beings who abide in the Mahayana, those of the highest acumen.

original: gang dag 'dod chen pa bzhin du 'khor ba yang mi 'dod cing /
analyzed: gang dag 'dod chen pa bzhin du 'khor ba yang mi 'dod cing /
translated: They do not aspire to cyclic existence as do the extremists.

original: mu stegs pa la sogs pa ltar thabs ma yin pa la zhugs pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: mu stegs pa la sogs pa ltar thabs ma yin pa la zhugs pa yang ma yin la /
translated: They do not practice what is not the means, as do the heterodox.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ltar thabs dang ldan par rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ltar thabs dang ldan par rtogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They do not practice the means, as do the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: 'on kyang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i lam du zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i lam du zhugs pa ste /
translated: However, they do enter the path to attain the equality of samsara and nirvana.

original: de dag mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la brten pa'i bsam pa can nye bar nyon mongs pa med pa'i 'khor ba la brten pa'i sbyor ba can /
analyzed: de dag mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la brten pa'i bsam pa can nye bar nyon mongs pa med pa'i 'khor ba la brten pa'i sbyor ba can /
translated: They have the intention of relying on nonabiding nirvana and the practice of relying on samsara without affliction.

original: snying rje dang lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan pa rab tu gnas pa rtsa ba yongs su dag par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: snying rje dang lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan pa rab tu gnas pa rtsa ba yongs su dag par gyur pa yin no //
translated: They are firmly established in compassion and superior intention, and have become completely purified in their basis.

original: de la sems can gang dag srid pa 'dod pa'i 'dod chen po dang / der nges par lhung ba'i chos 'di pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la sems can gang dag srid pa 'dod pa'i 'dod chen po dang / der nges par lhung ba'i chos 'di pa nyid de /
translated: Among sentient beings, those who desire existence are the hedonists, and those who are definitely fallen into that are the adherents of this doctrine.

original: de gnyis ni log pa nyid dungs pa'i sems can gyi phung po zhes bya'o//
analyzed: de gnyis ni log pa nyid dungs pa'i sems can gyi phung po zhes bya'o//
translated: These two are called the group of sentient beings who are wrongly oriented.

original: @90a * // gang dag srid pa dang bral bar 'dod kyang thabs ma yin pa la zhugs pa de dag ni /
analyzed: @90a * // gang dag srid pa dang bral bar 'dod kyang thabs ma yin pa la zhugs pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who desire to be free from existence but who are engaged in what is not the method are

original: ma nges pa'i sems can gyi phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i sems can gyi phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: called the group of undetermined sentient beings.

original: gang dag srid pa dang bral bar 'dod pa thabs la zhugs pa dang / de gnyis ka mngon par mi 'dod pa mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i lam du zhugs pa de dag ni yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i sems can gyi phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag srid pa dang bral bar 'dod pa thabs la zhugs pa dang / de gnyis ka mngon par mi 'dod pa mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i lam du zhugs pa de dag ni yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i sems can gyi phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who desire to be free from existence and are engaged in the method, and those who are engaged in the path of attaining the equality of not desiring either of those two are called the group of sentient beings who are correctly determined.

original: de la theg pa chen po la yang dag par rab tu gnas pa'i sems can gyi sgrib pa med pa rtogs pa ma gtogs pa gzhan sems can rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: de la theg pa chen po la yang dag par rab tu gnas pa'i sems can gyi sgrib pa med pa rtogs pa ma gtogs pa gzhan sems can rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag ste /
translated: Among them, there are four kinds of sentient beings who are not free from obscurations, except for those sentient beings who are correctly established in the Great Vehicle and have realized the absence of obscurations.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'dod chen pa dang / mu stegs pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: 'dod chen pa dang / mu stegs pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas te /
translated: those with great desire, tīrthikas, śrāvakas, and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de dag la ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams mi rtog pa dang / mngon sum du byed par mi 'gyur ba'i sgrib pa 'di bzhin yang dag par gnas so //
analyzed: de dag la ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams mi rtog pa dang / mngon sum du byed par mi 'gyur ba'i sgrib pa 'di bzhin yang dag par gnas so //
translated: In them, these four obscurations to the non-conceptualization and realization of the Tathagata-garbha are present.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:🔽The obscuration of the extremists who hate the Mahayana Dharma, the antidote to which is the Bodhisattvas' meditation on faith in the Mahayana Dharma;

original: gang gi gnyen por byang chub sems dpa' rnams theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa sgom pa theg pa chen po'i chos la sdang ba 'dod chen pa rnams kyi sgrib pa dang / gang gi gnyen por byang chub sems dpa' rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa chos rnams la bdag tu lta ba gzhan mu stegs can rnams kyi sgrib pa dang /
analyzed: gang gi gnyen por byang chub sems dpa' rnams theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa sgom pa theg pa chen po'i chos la sdang ba 'dod chen pa rnams kyi sgrib pa dang / gang gi gnyen por byang chub sems dpa' rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa chos rnams la bdag tu lta ba gzhan mu stegs can rnams kyi sgrib pa dang /
translated: The obscuration of the heterodox who have the view of self with regard to phenomena, the antidote to which is the Bodhisattvas' meditation on the perfection of wisdom;

original: gang gi gnyen por byang chub sems dpa' rnams nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgom pa 'khor ba la sdug bsngal bar rab tu shes shing sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa nyan thos kyi theg pa rnams kyi sgrib pa dang / gang gi gnyen por byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying rje chen po sgom pa sems can gyi don la rgyab kyis phyogs shing sems can gyi don la mi ltos pa nyid rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams kyi sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi gnyen por byang chub sems dpa' rnams nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgom pa 'khor ba la sdug bsngal bar rab tu shes shing sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa nyan thos kyi theg pa rnams kyi sgrib pa dang / gang gi gnyen por byang chub sems dpa' rnams snying rje chen po sgom pa sems can gyi don la rgyab kyis phyogs shing sems can gyi don la mi ltos pa nyid rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams kyi sgrib pa ste /
translated: The obscuration of the pratyekabuddha vehicle is the turning away from the benefit of sentient beings and the lack of regard for the benefit of sentient beings, the antidote to which is the bodhisattvas’ meditation on great compassion.🔽The four obscurations of these four kinds of sentient beings are these four.

original: gang gi gnyen bor mos pa la sogs pa'i chos 'di bzhi bsgoms nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa'i don chos kyi sku rnam par dag pa mthar phyin pa thob par 'gyur ba sems can rnam pa 'di bzhi'i sgrib pa ni rnam pa bzhi po🔽'di dag yin no //
analyzed: gang gi gnyen bor mos pa la sogs pa'i chos 'di bzhi bsgoms nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams bla na med pa'i don chos kyi sku rnam par dag pa mthar phyin pa thob par 'gyur ba sems can rnam pa 'di bzhi'i sgrib pa ni rnam pa bzhi po🔽'di dag yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas who meditate on these four dharmas such as aspiration attain the ultimate, the pure dharmakāya, the unsurpassable goal.

original: rnam par dag pa bzhi 'grub pa'i rgyu bzhi po 'di dag dang ldan pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su chos kyi rgyal po'i sras su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa bzhi 'grub pa'i rgyu bzhi po 'di dag dang ldan pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su chos kyi rgyal po'i sras su 'gyur ro //
translated: One who has these four causes for achieving the four purifications becomes a son of the Dharma King in the Tathagata family.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: theg @90b mchog la mos sa bon shes rab ni //
analyzed: theg @90b mchog la mos sa bon shes rab ni //
translated: Those who have the seed of faith in the Great Vehicle,

original: sangs rgyas chos skyed ma dang bsam gtan gyi //🔽bde ba'i mngal gnas snying rje'i ma ma can //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos skyed ma dang bsam gtan gyi // bde ba'i mngal gnas snying rje'i ma ma can //
translated: the mother of the Buddhas' qualities,🔽the womb of the bliss of meditation,

original: gang yin de dag thub pa'i rjes skyes sras //
analyzed: gang yin de dag thub pa'i rjes skyes sras //
translated: and the nurse of compassion, are the sons born after the Muni.

original: de la 'bras bu'i don dang las kyi don las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu'i don dang las kyi don las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse on the topic of result and the topic of function:🔽The result of the perfections is the possession of the qualities of

original: gtsang bdag bde dang rtag nyid kyi //🔽yon tan pha rol phyin pa 'bras //🔽sdug bsngal yid 'byung zhi thob par //
analyzed: gtsang bdag bde dang rtag nyid kyi // yon tan pha rol phyin pa 'bras // sdug bsngal yid 'byung zhi thob par //
translated: purity, self, bliss, and eternity.

original: 'dun dang smon pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'dun dang smon pa'i las can no //
translated: Its function is aspiration and prayer,🔽in order to turn away from suffering and attain peace.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa phyed snga mas ci bstan zhe na /
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa phyed snga mas ci bstan zhe na /
translated: What is shown by the first half of the verse?

original: 'di dag 'bras ni mdor bsdu na //
analyzed: 'di dag 'bras ni mdor bsdu na //
translated: The result of these perfections, in brief,

original: chos kyi sku la phyin ci log / rnam pa bzhi las bzlog pa yi //
analyzed: chos kyi sku la phyin ci log / rnam pa bzhi las bzlog pa yi //
translated: is the Dharma Body, which is the reversal of the four errors🔽with regard to purity, self, bliss, and eternity.

original: gnyen pos rab tu phye ba nyid //🔽mos pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams rnam par dag pa'i rgyur bshad pa'i chos bzhi po gang yin pa de dag gi 'bras bu ni mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: gnyen pos rab tu phye ba nyid // mos pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams rnam par dag pa'i rgyur bshad pa'i chos bzhi po gang yin pa de dag gi 'bras bu ni mdor bsdu na /
translated: The dharmakāya is the result of the four causes that were explained as the causes for the purification of the Tathāgata-essence, such as faith, etc.

original: go rims ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi las bzlog pa'i gnyen por de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku la yon tan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa bzhir blta'o //
analyzed: go rims ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi las bzlog pa'i gnyen por de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku la yon tan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa bzhir blta'o //
translated: In brief, the result of those four is the four perfections of the qualities of the Tathāgata’s dharmakāya, which are the antidotes that are the opposites of the four errors.

original: de la gang zhig gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po mi rtag pa la rtag go snyam par 'du shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la bde'o snyam pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag go snyam pa dang ; mi gtsang ba la gtsang ngo snyam par 'du shes pa 'di ni phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi zhes brjod la /
analyzed: de la gang zhig gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po mi rtag pa la rtag go snyam par 'du shes pa dang / sdug bsngal la bde'o snyam pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag go snyam pa dang ; mi gtsang ba la gtsang ngo snyam par 'du shes pa 'di ni phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi zhes brjod la /
translated: The four errors are the notion that impermanent things such as form are permanent, the notion that suffering is happiness, the notion that what is not a self is a self, and the notion that what is impure is pure.

original: 'di las bzlog pa la ni phyin ci ma log pa rnam pa bzhi nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di las bzlog pa la ni phyin ci ma log pa rnam pa bzhi nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The four non-errors should be understood as the opposites of those.

original: rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four aspects?

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po de nyid la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po de nyid la mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / mi gtsang ba'i 'du shes gang yin pa ste /
translated: They are the perception of impermanence, the perception of suffering, the perception of non-self, and the perception of the impure, in regard to the entities of form, etc.

original: 'di ni phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi las bzlog pa'o //
translated: This is the reversal of the four errors.

original: de yang rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de yang rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku'i dbang du byas te /
translated: Moreover, the four perfections of the qualities of the Tathāgata’s Dharma Body are posited as the antidotes to the errors of permanence, etc.

original: 'dir phyin ci log tu 'dod do //🔽gang gi gnyen bor de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku'i yon tan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa bzhi rnam par gzhag pa ste 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dir phyin ci log tu 'dod do // gang gi gnyen bor de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku'i yon tan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa bzhi rnam par gzhag pa ste 'di lta ste /
translated: They are considered to be errors here.

original: rtag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bde ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bdag gi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / gtsang ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bde ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bdag gi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / gtsang ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: They are the perfection of permanence, the perfection of bliss, the perfection of self, and the perfection of purity.

original: gzhung 'di yang @91a * //
analyzed: gzhung 'di yang @91a * //
translated: This treatise is also called

original: rgya cher ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: rgya cher ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The extensive [explanation] should be understood according to the sutra.

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams ni zin pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams la phyin ci log tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams ni zin pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams la phyin ci log tu gyur pa ste /
translated: Bhagavan, sentient beings are mistaken with regard to the appropriated aggregates, which are appropriated and grasped.

original: de dag ni mi rtag pa la rtag par 'du shes pa /
analyzed: de dag ni mi rtag pa la rtag par 'du shes pa /
translated: They perceive the impermanent as permanent,

original: sdug bsngal ba la bde bar 'du shes pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba la bde bar 'du shes pa /
translated: the painful as pleasurable,

original: bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa /
analyzed: bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa /
translated: the selfless as having a self,

original: mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar 'du shes pa lags so //🔽bcom ldan 'das nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyang stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis sngar ma mthong ba /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar 'du shes pa lags so // bcom ldan 'das nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyang stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis sngar ma mthong ba /
translated: and the impure as pure.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi yul de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku la phyin ci log tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi yul de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku la phyin ci log tu gyur pa'o //
translated: Bhagavan, all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are mistaken with regard to the dharmakāya of the Tathāgata, the object of the wisdom of omniscience, which was not seen before by the wisdom of emptiness.

original: bcom ldan 'das rtag par 'du shes pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rtag par 'du shes pa /
translated: Bhagavan, those sentient beings who perceive permanence,

original: bde bar 'du shes pa /
analyzed: bde bar 'du shes pa /
translated: pleasure,

original: bdag tu 'du shes pa /
analyzed: bdag tu 'du shes pa /
translated: a self,

original: gtsang bar 'du shes pa'i sems can de dang de dag ni /
analyzed: gtsang bar 'du shes pa'i sems can de dang de dag ni /
translated: and purity,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs las skyes ba'i sras lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs las skyes ba'i sras lags so //
translated: They are the sons born from the heart of the Bhagavat.

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can de dag ni phyin ci log tu gyur pa ma lags te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can de dag ni phyin ci log tu gyur pa ma lags te /
translated: Bhagavat, those beings are not mistaken.

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can de dag ni yang dag par mthong ba lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can de dag ni yang dag par mthong ba lags so //
translated: Bhagavat, those beings see correctly.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku nyid ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku nyid ni /
translated: Bhagavat, the dharmakaya of the Tathagata is

original: rtag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa /
analyzed: rtag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa /
translated: the perfection of permanence,

original: bde ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa /
analyzed: bde ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa /
translated: the perfection of bliss,

original: gtsang ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gtsang ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: the perfection of purity.

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku de ltar mthong ba de dag ni yang dag par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can gang dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku de ltar mthong ba de dag ni yang dag par mthong ba'o //
translated: Bhagavat, those beings who see the dharmakaya of the Tathagata in that way, they see correctly.

original: yang dag par mthong ba gang lags pa de dag thams cad ni bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs kyi sras lags so zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang dag par mthong ba gang lags pa de dag thams cad ni bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs kyi sras lags so zhes rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: Those who see correctly, all of them are the sons born from the heart of the Bhagavat.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku'i yon tan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzhi ni rgyu'i go rims kyis go rims las bzlog ste rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku'i yon tan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bzhi ni rgyu'i go rims kyis go rims las bzlog ste rig par bya'o //
translated: These four perfections of the qualities of the dharmakāya of the Tathāgatas should be known in reverse order from the order of their causes.

original: de la theg pa chen po'i chos la sdang ba /
analyzed: de la theg pa chen po'i chos la sdang ba /
translated: Here, the aversion to the Mahāyāna Dharma

original: 'dod chen pa rnams kyi mi gtsang ba'i 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba las bzlog nas /
analyzed: 'dod chen pa rnams kyi mi gtsang ba'i 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba las bzlog nas /
translated: is reversed from the delight in the impure saṃsāra of the extremists.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa bsgoms pa las ni 'bras bu gtsang ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob par blta'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa bsgoms pa las ni 'bras bu gtsang ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob par blta'o //
translated: From the cultivation of the Mahāyāna Dharma by the bodhisattvas, the result, the perfection of purity, is attained.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la bdag tu lta ba gzhan mu stegs pa dag gi yod pa ma yin pa bdag tu @91b 'dzin pa la mngon par dga' ba las bzlog nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa las ni 'bras
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la bdag tu lta ba gzhan mu stegs pa dag gi yod pa ma yin pa bdag tu @91b 'dzin pa la mngon par dga' ba las bzlog nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa las ni 'bras
translated: The grasping of a self in the five appropriated aggregates, which is the delight in the non-existent self-grasping of the tīrthikas, is reversed. From the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom, the result,

original: bu bdag dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'thob par blta'o //
analyzed: bu bdag dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'thob par blta'o //
translated: the perfection of the highest self, is attained.

original: 'di ltar mu stegs pa gzhan thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i dngos po bdag tu khas len la ;
analyzed: 'di ltar mu stegs pa gzhan thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i dngos po bdag tu khas len la ;
translated: Thus, all other tīrthikas accept that form and so on are things that are not the self by nature.

original: de dag gis ji ltar bzung ba'i dngos bo de yang bdag gi mtshan nyid kyis slu ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dus thams cad du bdag med do //
analyzed: de dag gis ji ltar bzung ba'i dngos bo de yang bdag gi mtshan nyid kyis slu ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dus thams cad du bdag med do //
translated: And because the things that they apprehend are deceptive by the character of the self, they are always selfless.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi ye shes kyis chos thams cad bdag med pa dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa brnyes la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi ye shes kyis chos thams cad bdag med pa dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa brnyes la /
translated: The Tathāgata, through the wisdom that is true just as it is, has attained the perfection of the highest selflessness of all phenomena.

original: des ji ltar gzigs pa'i bdag med pa yang bdag yod pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mi slu ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dus thams cad du bdag tu 'dod do //
analyzed: des ji ltar gzigs pa'i bdag med pa yang bdag yod pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mi slu ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dus thams cad du bdag tu 'dod do //
translated: And because the selflessness that he sees is not deceptive by the character of the nonexistence of the self, it is always asserted to be the self.

original: bdag med pa nyid bdag tu byas pa ste /
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid bdag tu byas pa ste /
translated: Selflessness itself is made into the self.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas ba zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas ba zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: “It is abiding through the mode of nonabiding.”

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams kyi 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba tsam mngon par 'dod pa las bzlog nas nam mkha'i mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa las ni 'bras bu 'jig rten dang 'jig rten
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams kyi 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba tsam mngon par 'dod pa las bzlog nas nam mkha'i mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa las ni 'bras bu 'jig rten dang 'jig rten
translated: The result of the perfection of constancy should be seen as the attainment of the highest mundane and supramundane bliss, from the cultivation of the concentration of the sky treasury and so on, in contrast to the desire of those of the sravaka vehicle who fear the sufferings of samsara to pacify the sufferings of samsara alone.🔽The result of the perfection of constancy should be seen as the attainment of the highest mundane and supramundane bliss, from the cultivation of the concentration of the sky treasury and so on, in contrast to the desire of those of the sravaka vehicle who fear the sufferings of samsara to pacify the sufferings of samsara alone.🔽The result of the perfection of constancy should be seen as the attainment of the highest mundane and supramundane bliss, from the cultivation of the concentration of the sky treasury and so on, in contrast to the desire of those of the sravaka vehicle who fear the sufferings of samsara to pacify the sufferings of samsara alone.

original: las 'das pa'i bde ba dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'thob par blta bar bya'o //🔽sems can gyi don la mi ltos par rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams kyis 'du 'ji med par gnas pa la mngon par dga' ba las bzlog nas /
analyzed: las 'das pa'i bde ba dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'thob par blta bar bya'o // sems can gyi don la mi ltos par rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams kyis 'du 'ji med par gnas pa la mngon par dga' ba las bzlog nas /
translated: The result of the perfection of constancy should be seen as the attainment of the highest mundane and supramundane bliss, from the cultivation of the concentration of the sky treasury and so on, in contrast to the desire of those of the sravaka vehicle who fear the sufferings of samsara to pacify the sufferings of samsara alone.🔽The result of the perfection of constancy should be seen as the attainment of the highest mundane and supramundane bliss, from the cultivation of the concentration of the sky treasury and so on, in contrast to the desire of those of the sravaka vehicle who fear the sufferings of samsara to pacify the sufferings of samsara alone.🔽The result of the perfection of constancy should be seen as the attainment of the highest mundane and supramundane bliss, from the cultivation of the concentration of the sky treasury and so on, in contrast to the desire of those of the sravaka vehicle who fear the sufferings of samsara to pacify the sufferings of samsara alone.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje chen po bsgoms pa las ni rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du sems can gyi don yongs su sbyong ba yongs su dag pa'i phyir 'bras bu rtag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'thob par
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje chen po bsgoms pa las ni rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du sems can gyi don yongs su sbyong ba yongs su dag pa'i phyir 'bras bu rtag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'thob par
translated: The result of the perfection of constancy should be seen as the attainment of the highest mundane and supramundane bliss, from the cultivation of the concentration of the sky treasury and so on, in contrast to the desire of those of the sravaka vehicle who fear the sufferings of samsara to pacify the sufferings of samsara alone.

original: blta bar bya'o //🔽de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pa dang / shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snying rje chen po bsgoms pa rnams kyi 'bras bu ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku gtsang ba dang /
analyzed: blta bar bya'o // de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mos pa dang / shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snying rje chen po bsgoms pa rnams kyi 'bras bu ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku gtsang ba dang /
translated: One should look at it.🔽Thus, the fruits of the bodhisattvas' cultivation of faith, knowledge, meditative concentration, and great compassion are, respectively, the accomplishment of the four perfections of the purity,

original: bdag dang / bad ba dang / rtag pa'i yon tan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams pa bzhi 'grub bo //
analyzed: bdag dang / bad ba dang / rtag pa'i yon tan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams pa bzhi 'grub bo //
translated: self, bliss, and permanence of the Tathagata's Dharma Body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'di dag gis chos kyi dbyings kyi mthar thug ba nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas @92a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'di dag gis chos kyi dbyings kyi mthar thug ba nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas @92a * //
translated: The Tathagata is said to have reached the end of the realm of Dharma, the limit of space,

original: klas pa phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: klas pa phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa zhes brjod do //
translated: and the final limit of the future.

original: 'di ltar theg pa chen po'i chos dam pa la lhag par mos pa bsgoms pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa shin tu gtsang ba'i chos kyi dbyings kyi mthar thug pa brnyes pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings kyi mthar thug pa nyid 'grub po //
analyzed: 'di ltar theg pa chen po'i chos dam pa la lhag par mos pa bsgoms pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa shin tu gtsang ba'i chos kyi dbyings kyi mthar thug pa brnyes pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings kyi mthar thug pa nyid 'grub po //
translated: Thus, by cultivating faith in the sublime Dharma of the Great Vehicle, one reaches the end of the realm of Dharma, because one attains the Tathagata's extremely pure Dharma Body.🔽By cultivating knowledge, one reaches the limit of space, because one attains the power of knowledge that pervades the entire realm of space.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid bsgoms pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid bsgoms pas /
translated: Because of cultivating the perfection of wisdom itself,

original: sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten nam mkha' ltar bdag med pa'i mthar thug pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir dang / nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pas chos kyi dbang phyug dam pa thams cad du khyab pa kun tu ston pa'i phyir nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas klas pa'o //
analyzed: sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten nam mkha' ltar bdag med pa'i mthar thug pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir dang / nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pas chos kyi dbang phyug dam pa thams cad du khyab pa kun tu ston pa'i phyir nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas klas pa'o //
translated: one realizes that sentient beings and the inanimate world are ultimately devoid of self, like space. And because of cultivating the meditative stabilization of the sky treasury and so on, one displays the supreme mastery of phenomena, pervading everywhere.

original: snying rje chen po bsgoms pas sems can thams cad la dus mu mtha' med par snying rje dang ldan pa'i phyir na phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa yin no //
analyzed: snying rje chen po bsgoms pas sems can thams cad la dus mu mtha' med par snying rje dang ldan pa'i phyir na phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa yin no //
translated: Because of cultivating great compassion, one has compassion for all sentient beings for an endless time.

original: zag pa med pa'i dbyings la gnas pa'i dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / dbang thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku'i yon tan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa 'di bzhi thob pa'i gegs su 'gyur ba ni 'di bzhi ste /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbyings la gnas pa'i dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / dbang thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku'i yon tan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa 'di bzhi thob pa'i gegs su 'gyur ba ni 'di bzhi ste /
translated: These four are also obstacles to the attainment of the four perfections of the qualities of the Dharma Body of the Tathagata by the Arhats and Pratyekabuddhas who abide in the uncontaminated realm, and by the Bodhisattvas who have attained sovereignty.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: rkyen gyi mtshan nyid dang / rgyu'i mtshan nyid dang / 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang / 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rkyen gyi mtshan nyid dang / rgyu'i mtshan nyid dang / 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang / 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of condition, the characteristic of cause, the characteristic of origination, and the characteristic of destruction.

original: de la rkyen gyi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: de la rkyen gyi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of condition is

original: ma rig pa'i bag chags kyis te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i bag chags kyis te /
translated: the instinct for nescience.

original: 'du byed rnams kyis ma rig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyis ma rig pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the nescience of the formative forces.

original: rgyu'i mtshan nyid ni ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi sa'i rkyen can zag pa med pa'i las nyid de /
analyzed: rgyu'i mtshan nyid ni ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi sa'i rkyen can zag pa med pa'i las nyid de /
translated: The characteristic of cause is the very instinct for nescience, conditioned by the ground, and it is uncontaminated karma.

original: 'du byed bzhin no //
analyzed: 'du byed bzhin no //
translated: It is like the formative forces.

original: 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi sa'i rkyen dang ldan pa zag pa med pa'i las kyi rgyu can yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus rnam pa gsum grub pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi sa'i rkyen dang ldan pa zag pa med pa'i las kyi rgyu can yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus rnam pa gsum grub pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of origination is the establishment of the three kinds of mental bodies, which are caused by uncontaminated karma and are conditioned by the causal condition of the ground of nescient latent afflictions.

original: nye bar len pa bzhi'i rkyen dang ldan pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi rgyu can gyi srid pa gsum mngon par grub pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa bzhi'i rkyen dang ldan pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi rgyu can gyi srid pa gsum mngon par grub pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the establishment of the three existences, which are caused by contaminated karma and are conditioned by the causal condition of the four clingings.

original: 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ni yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus rnam pa gsum mngon par 'grub pa'i rkyen can bsam gyis mi khyab par yongs su bsgyur ba'i 'chi 'pho ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid ni yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus rnam pa gsum mngon par 'grub pa'i rkyen can bsam gyis mi khyab par yongs su bsgyur ba'i 'chi 'pho ba ste /
translated: The characteristic of destruction is the inconceivable transformation at death, which is conditioned by the establishment of the three kinds of mental bodies.

original: skye ba'i rkyen can gyi rga shi bzhin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen can gyi rga shi bzhin no //
translated: It is like aging and death, which are conditioned by birth.

original: de la dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / dbang thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams @92b cad kyi rten du gyur pa ma rig pa'i bag chags kyis ma spangs pas na nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dri nga ba'i bag chags thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir gtsang ba'i pha
analyzed: de la dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / dbang thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams @92b cad kyi rten du gyur pa ma rig pa'i bag chags kyis ma spangs pas na nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dri nga ba'i bag chags thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir gtsang ba'i pha
translated: The arhats, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas who have attained the levels do not eliminate the instinct for ignorance, which is the support for all the branch afflictions. Therefore, they possess all the instincts for the smell of the stains of affliction.

original: rol tu phyin pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa mi 'thob po //
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa mi 'thob po //
translated: Therefore, they do not attain the perfection of purity to the ultimate degree.

original: ma rig pa'i bag chags kyis de nyid la brten nas mtshan ma'i spros pa kun du spyod pa phra mo dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i bag chags kyis de nyid la brten nas mtshan ma'i spros pa kun du spyod pa phra mo dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they possess the subtle engagement in the proliferation of signs based on that very ignorance,

original: da dag gi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu 'dus ma byas pa mi 'thob po //
analyzed: da dag gi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu 'dus ma byas pa mi 'thob po //
translated: they do not attain the perfection of the utterly unconditioned.

original: de la ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi sa de dang ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi sa'i rkyen can gyi mtshan ma'i spros pa spyod pa phra mos kun nas bslang ba zag pa med pa'i las la brten nas yid kyi rang bzhin gyi phung po kun 'byung ba'i
analyzed: de la ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi sa de dang ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi sa'i rkyen can gyi mtshan ma'i spros pa spyod pa phra mos kun nas bslang ba zag pa med pa'i las la brten nas yid kyi rang bzhin gyi phung po kun 'byung ba'i
translated: Because of that, the subtle activity of the proliferation of signs, which is conditioned by the ground of nescient latent impulses, and which is motivated by the subtle activity of the proliferation of signs conditioned by the ground of nescient latent impulses, is the origin of the aggregates which are of the nature of mind, based on uncontaminated karma.

original: phyir de 'gags pa shin tu bde ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi 'thob po //
analyzed: phyir de 'gags pa shin tu bde ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi 'thob po //
translated: Therefore, as long as that is not stopped, the perfection of the attainment of the highest bliss is not obtained.

original: de la ji srid du nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ma lus pa 'gags pa las gyur pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams mngon du ma byas pa de srid du bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yongs su bsgyur ba dang ldan pa'i🔽'chi 'pho ba dang mi 'bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la ji srid du nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ma lus pa 'gags pa las gyur pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams mngon du ma byas pa de srid du bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yongs su bsgyur ba dang ldan pa'i 'chi 'pho ba dang mi 'bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Therein, as long as the transformation of the basis of the Tathāgata is not actualized, due to the non-cessation of the afflictions, karma, and the afflicted birth,🔽because of not being free from the death and transmigration that possesses the inconceivable transformation,

original: gzhan du gyur pa med pa rtag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi 'thob po //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa med pa rtag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi 'thob po //
translated: the perfection of the changeless permanence is not obtained.

original: de la ma rig pa'i bag chags kyis ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa'i bag chags kyis ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bzhin no //
translated: The latent impressions of ignorance are like the afflictive afflictions.

original: zag pa med pa'i las mngon par 'du byed pa ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i las mngon par 'du byed pa ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa bzhin no //
translated: The formation of uncontaminated karma is like the affliction of karma.

original: yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus rnam pa gsum mngon par grub pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab par yongs su bsgyur ba dang ldan pa'i 'chi 'pho ba ni skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus rnam pa gsum mngon par grub pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab par yongs su bsgyur ba dang ldan pa'i 'chi 'pho ba ni skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bzhin no //
translated: The establishment of the three mental bodies and the death and transference that possess inconceivable transformation are like the affliction of birth.

original: gzhung 'di yang rgyas par ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhung 'di yang rgyas par ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par bya ste /
translated: This treatise should be understood in detail according to the sutras.

original: bcom ldan 'das dper na len pa'i rkyen gyis zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi rgyu las byung ba srid pa gsum 'byung ba de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi sa'i rkyen gyis zag pa med pa'i las kyi rgyu las byung ba'i dgra
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dper na len pa'i rkyen gyis zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi rgyu las byung ba srid pa gsum 'byung ba de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi sa'i rkyen gyis zag pa med pa'i las kyi rgyu las byung ba'i dgra
translated: Bhagavan, just as the three existences arise from the cause of contaminated karma with appropriation as a condition, in the same way, Bhagavan, the three existences arise from the cause of uncontaminated karma with the ground of the latent tendencies of ignorance as a condition.

original: bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / dbang thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus gsum 'byung ste /
analyzed: bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / dbang thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus gsum 'byung ste /
translated: The three mental bodies of the arhats, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas who have attained mastery arise from that.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i bag chags kyis gsum po 'di dag tu yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus gsum po 'di dag 'byung ba dang zag pa med pa'i las mngon par 'grub pa'i rkyen lags so zhes @93a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma rig pa'i bag chags kyis gsum po 'di dag tu yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus gsum po 'di dag 'byung ba dang zag pa med pa'i las mngon par 'grub pa'i rkyen lags so zhes @93a * //
translated: Bhagavatī, these three mental bodies arise from these three due to the imprints of ignorance and are the conditions for accomplishing uncontaminated karma.

original: rgyas bar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyas bar 'byung ngo //
translated: It continues extensively.

original: gang gi phyir dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / dbang thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus 'di gsum la gtsang ba dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / rtag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa med pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / dbang thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus 'di gsum la gtsang ba dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / rtag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa med pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because these three mental bodies of the arhats, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas who have attained mastery are not the perfections of purity, self, bliss, and permanence,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku kho na rtag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku kho na rtag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa /
translated: only the dharmakāya of the Tathāgata is the perfection of permanence,

original: bde ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa /
analyzed: bde ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa /
translated: the perfection of bliss,🔽the perfection of self,

original: bdag gi pha rol tu phyin pa /
analyzed: bdag gi pha rol tu phyin pa /
translated: and🔽the perfection of purity.

original: gtsang ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gtsang ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the perfection of purity.🔽It is pure because of natural purity

original: de ni rang bzhin dag phyir dang // bag chags spangs phyir gtsang ba yin //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin dag phyir dang // bag chags spangs phyir gtsang ba yin //
translated: and because of the abandonment of the instinct for impurity.

original: bdag dang bdag med spros pa dag /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag med spros pa dag /
translated: The self of the imagined reality is the pacification of the elaborations of self and selflessness.

original: nye bar zhi bdam pa'i bdag / yid kyi rang bzhin phung po dang // de rgyu log phyir bde ba nyid //🔽'khor ba dang ni mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: nye bar zhi bdam pa'i bdag / yid kyi rang bzhin phung po dang // de rgyu log phyir bde ba nyid // 'khor ba dang ni mya ngan 'das //
translated: The self of the reality of dependent knowledge-only is bliss, because of the cessation of the aggregates which are the cause of the mind.🔽The self of the reality of full perfection is permanence,

original: mnyam pa nyid du rtogs phyir rtag //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid du rtogs phyir rtag //
translated: because of the realization of the equality of cyclic life and nirvana.

original: mdor bsdu na rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis na de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku gtsang ba'i pha rol tu phyin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis na de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku gtsang ba'i pha rol tu phyin par rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, the Dharma Body of the Tathagata should be known as the perfection of purity through two causes:

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa dang / khyad par gyi mtshan nyid dri ma med pa'i yongs su dag pas so //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa dang / khyad par gyi mtshan nyid dri ma med pa'i yongs su dag pas so //
translated: through the general characteristic of natural purity and through the special characteristic of the purity of stainlessness.

original: rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis bdag gi pha rol tu phyin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis bdag gi pha rol tu phyin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The perfection of self should be known through two causes:

original: mu stegs kyi mtha' dang bral bas bdag gi spros pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / nyan thos kyi mtha' spangs pas bdag med pa'i spros pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu stegs kyi mtha' dang bral bas bdag gi spros pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / nyan thos kyi mtha' spangs pas bdag med pa'i spros pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from the extreme of the heterodox, it is free from the proliferation of self, and because it is free from the extreme of the śrāvakas, it is free from the proliferation of selflessness.

original: rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis bde ba'i pha rol tu phyin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis bde ba'i pha rol tu phyin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The perfection of happiness should be understood through two causes.

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'i rnam pa thams cad spangs pas bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba bcom pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i rnam pa thams cad mngon du byas pas yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus 'gags pa mngon du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'i rnam pa thams cad spangs pas bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba bcom pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa'i rnam pa thams cad mngon du byas pas yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus 'gags pa mngon du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it abandons all aspects of the origin of suffering, it destroys the connection with habitual tendencies, and because it realizes all aspects of the cessation of suffering, it realizes the cessation of the mental body.

original: rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis rtag ba'i pha rol tu phyin par rig par bya'o //🔽'khor ba mi rtag mi 'brid pas chad pa'i mthar ma lhung ba'i phyir dang / mya ngan las 'das pa rtag pa mi snon pas /
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis rtag ba'i pha rol tu phyin par rig par bya'o // 'khor ba mi rtag mi 'brid pas chad pa'i mthar ma lhung ba'i phyir dang / mya ngan las 'das pa rtag pa mi snon pas /
translated: The perfection of permanence should be understood through two causes.

original: rtag pa'i mthar ma lhung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa'i mthar ma lhung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because samsara is impermanent and does not diminish, it does not fall into the extreme of annihilation, and because nirvana is permanent and does not increase,🔽it does not fall into the extreme of permanence.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te 'du byed mi rtag go zhes bgyi bar lta na de'i chad par lta bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te 'du byed mi rtag go zhes bgyi bar lta na de'i chad par lta bar 'gyur te /
translated: Bhagavan, if one views compositional activity as impermanent, that is a view of annihilation.

original: de ni de'i yang dag pa ma lags pa'i lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i yang dag pa ma lags pa'i lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That is his incorrect view.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te mya ngan las 'das @93b pa rtag pa zhes bgyi bar lta na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te mya ngan las 'das @93b pa rtag pa zhes bgyi bar lta na /
translated: Bhagavan, if one views nirvana as permanent,

original: de ni de'i rtag pa'i lta bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni de'i rtag pa'i lta bar 'gyur te /
translated: that is a view of permanence.

original: de ni de'i yang dag pa ma lags pa'i lta bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i yang dag pa ma lags pa'i lta bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: That is his incorrect view.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul gyi sgo 'dis ni don dam par 'khor ba nyid mya ngan las 'das par brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul gyi sgo 'dis ni don dam par 'khor ba nyid mya ngan las 'das par brjod pa yin te /
translated: By this method of the dharmadhatu, samsara itself is said to be nirvana in the ultimate,

original: gnyis ka ltar rnam par mi rtog pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka ltar rnam par mi rtog pa mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are actualized as non-conceptual non-abiding nirvana.

original: de lta mod kyi rgyu gnyis kyis khyad par med par sems can thams cad la nye ba dang ring ba 'brel pas mi gnas pa'i gnas thob pa tsam bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi rgyu gnyis kyis khyad par med par sems can thams cad la nye ba dang ring ba 'brel pas mi gnas pa'i gnas thob pa tsam bstan pa yin no //
translated: Still, by means of two causes, he is shown to be without distinction, near to all beings, and not abiding in any abode.

original: rgyu gnyis po gang dag gis she na /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis po gang dag gis she na /
translated: By means of which two causes?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni khyad par med par sems can thams cad la nye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni khyad par med par sems can thams cad la nye ba ma yin te /
translated: Here the bodhisattva is not near to all beings without distinction,

original: shes rab kyis sred pa'i bag la nyal mtha' dag spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyis sred pa'i bag la nyal mtha' dag spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by means of wisdom he has abandoned all the latent predispositions of craving.

original: ring ba yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ring ba yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is he far away,

original: snying rje chen pos de dag yongs su ma btang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rje chen pos de dag yongs su ma btang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because by means of great compassion he has not abandoned them.

original: 'di ni mi gnas pa'i rang bzhin yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rjes su 'thob pa'i thabs te /
analyzed: 'di ni mi gnas pa'i rang bzhin yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rjes su 'thob pa'i thabs te /
translated: This is the method for attaining the nature of nonabiding complete enlightenment.

original: shes rab kyis ni byang chub sems dpa'i sred pa'i bag la nyal mtha' dag spangs pas na bdag la phan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni byang chub sems dpa'i sred pa'i bag la nyal mtha' dag spangs pas na bdag la phan pa'i phyir /
translated: By means of wisdom, the bodhisattva has abandoned all the latent predispositions of craving, and so he is not near to himself.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la brten pa'i bsam ba can yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i rigs can bzhin du 'khor ba la mi gnas la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la brten pa'i bsam ba can yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i rigs can bzhin du 'khor ba la mi gnas la /
translated: They do not remain in samsara like those who have the attitude of relying on nirvana, who are of the type that does not pass into nirvana.

original: snying rje chen pos sdug bsngal ba'i sems can yongs su ma btang bas ni gzhan la phan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snying rje chen pos sdug bsngal ba'i sems can yongs su ma btang bas ni gzhan la phan pa'i phyir /
translated: But because of their great compassion, they do not abandon suffering sentient beings.

original: 'khor ba la brten pa'i sbyor ba can zhi ba bgrod pa gcig pa'i rigs can bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas so //
analyzed: 'khor ba la brten pa'i sbyor ba can zhi ba bgrod pa gcig pa'i rigs can bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas so //
translated: And for the sake of others, they do not remain in nirvana like those who have the attitude of relying on samsara, who are of the type that goes to peace alone.

original: de ltar na chos gnyis po 'di ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rtsa ba'i gnas su bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar na chos gnyis po 'di ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi rtsa ba'i gnas su bstan pa ni /
translated: So these two qualities are taught to be the root basis of unsurpassable enlightenment.

original: bdag sred ma lus shes rab kyis bcad de //
analyzed: bdag sred ma lus shes rab kyis bcad de //
translated: With wisdom, they cut through all attachment to self

original: sems can sred phyir brtse ldan zhi thob min //
analyzed: sems can sred phyir brtse ldan zhi thob min //
translated: And, out of love for beings, do not attain peace.

original: de ltar blo brtse byang chub thabs brten nas //
analyzed: de ltar blo brtse byang chub thabs brten nas //
translated: Thus, with intelligence, love, and the means of enlightenment,

original: 'phags pa 'khor ba'am mya ngan 'da' mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'khor ba'am mya ngan 'da' mi 'gyur //
translated: The noble ones do not remain in samsara or nirvana.

original: de la sngar gyi dbang du byas pa'i las kyi don las brtsams pa'i tshigs su bcad pa phyed phyi mas ci ston zhe na /
analyzed: de la sngar gyi dbang du byas pa'i las kyi don las brtsams pa'i tshigs su bcad pa phyed phyi mas ci ston zhe na /
translated: What does the second half of the verse, beginning with “If the buddha-potential did not exist,” show, in terms of the meaning of the word karma as previously explained?

original: gal te sangs rgyas khams med na //
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas khams med na //
translated: If the buddha-potential did not exist,

original: sdug la'ang skyo bar mi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: sdug la'ang skyo bar mi 'gyur zhing //
translated: there would be no disgust with suffering,

original: mya ngan 'das la 'dod @94a * //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das la 'dod @94a * //
translated: no desire for nirvana,

original: pa dang // don gnyer smon pa'ang med par 'gyur //
analyzed: pa dang // don gnyer smon pa'ang med par 'gyur //
translated: no striving, no aspiration.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ma mchis na ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ma mchis na ni /
translated: “Blessed One, if the essence of the tathiigata did not exist,

original: sdug bsngal la yang skyo bar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la yang skyo bar mi 'gyur na /
translated: there would be no disgust with suffering,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la 'dod pa dang / 'dun pa dang / don du gnyer ba dang / smon pa yang med par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la 'dod pa dang / 'dun pa dang / don du gnyer ba dang / smon pa yang med par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and there would be no desire for, no aspiration to, no striving for, no wish for nirvana.”

original: de la mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: de la mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

original: sangs rgyas kyi khams rnam par dag pa'i rigs ni log pa nyid du nges pa'i sems can rnams la yang las rnam pa gnyis nye bar gnas par byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi khams rnam par dag pa'i rigs ni log pa nyid du nges pa'i sems can rnams la yang las rnam pa gnyis nye bar gnas par byed de /
translated: the buddha-potential, the potential for the purification of the buddha element, is present in sentient beings who are destined for nirvana, and it is present in two ways.

original: 'khor ba la sdug bsngal ba'i nyes pa mthong ba la brten nas skyo ba skyed par byed pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la bde ba'i phan yon mthong ba la brten nas /
analyzed: 'khor ba la sdug bsngal ba'i nyes pa mthong ba la brten nas skyo ba skyed par byed pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la bde ba'i phan yon mthong ba la brten nas /
translated: On the basis of seeing the benefits of happiness in nirvana, one generates

original: 'dun pa dang / 'dod pa dang / don du gnyer ba dang / smon pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / 'dod pa dang / don du gnyer ba dang / smon pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: aspiration, desire, striving, and prayer.

original: de la 'dun pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Aspiration is the desire for something.

original: 'dod pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don thob pa la phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don thob pa la phyogs pa'o //
translated: Desire is the orientation toward obtaining the desired object.

original: don du gnyer ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don thob pa'i thabs tshol ba'o //
analyzed: don du gnyer ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don thob pa'i thabs tshol ba'o //
translated: Striving is the search for the means to obtain the desired object.

original: smon pa ni gang mngon par 'dod pa'i don la sems mngon par 'dun par byed pa'o //🔽srid dang mya ngan 'das la de'i //
analyzed: smon pa ni gang mngon par 'dod pa'i don la sems mngon par 'dun par byed pa'o // srid dang mya ngan 'das la de'i //
translated: Prayer is the mental orientation toward the desired object.🔽The seeing of the faults of suffering and the benefits of happiness

original: sdug bde'i skyon yon mthong ba 'di //
analyzed: sdug bde'i skyon yon mthong ba 'di //
translated: in cyclic existence and nirvana,

original: rigs yod las yin gang phyir de //
analyzed: rigs yod las yin gang phyir de //
translated: respectively, is due to the existence of the potential,

original: rigs med dag la med phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs med dag la med phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist in those without the potential.

original: dkar po'i chos dang ldan pa'i gang zag gis 'khor ba la sdug bsngal gyi nyes pa mthong ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la bde ba'i phan yon mthong ba gang yin pa 'di yang rigs yod pa las gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dkar po'i chos dang ldan pa'i gang zag gis 'khor ba la sdug bsngal gyi nyes pa mthong ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la bde ba'i phan yon mthong ba gang yin pa 'di yang rigs yod pa las gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: This is also due to the existence of the potential, because it is the person who possesses virtuous qualities who sees the faults of suffering in cyclic existence and sees the benefits of happiness in nirvana.

original: rgyu med rkyen med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med rkyen med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not without a cause or a condition.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽gal te sdig pa mi zad pa dang ldan pa'i tshul gyis rgyu med rkyen med par der 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / gal te sdig pa mi zad pa dang ldan pa'i tshul gyis rgyu med rkyen med par der 'gyur na ni /
translated: Why is that?🔽If it were so without a cause or a condition,

original: log sred can yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i rigs can rnams la yang der 'gyur na /
analyzed: log sred can yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i rigs can rnams la yang der 'gyur na /
translated: then even those who are of the type who do not attain nirvana and who have inexhaustible evil karma would become so.🔽But as long as they do not generate the three types of faith,🔽which are generated by relying on a holy being and so on,

original: ji srid du glo bur gyi dri ma rnam par dag pa'i rigs skyes bu dam pa la brten pa la sogs pa 'khor lo bzhi yang dag par 'byor pa'i tshul gyis /🔽gsum las gang yang rung ba'i chos la mos pa /
analyzed: ji srid du glo bur gyi dri ma rnam par dag pa'i rigs skyes bu dam pa la brten pa la sogs pa 'khor lo bzhi yang dag par 'byor pa'i tshul gyis / gsum las gang yang rung ba'i chos la mos pa /
translated: and as long as they do not perfect the four wheels,

original: skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de srid du ni 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de srid du ni 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: they do not become so.

original: gang gi phyir de'i 'og tu tha na log pa nyid du nges pa'i rgyud du 'gyur ba'i sems @94b can rnams kyi lus la yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi ye shes kyi 'od zer phog pas de dag la phan 'dogs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i 'og tu tha na log pa nyid du nges pa'i rgyud du 'gyur ba'i sems @94b can rnams kyi lus la yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi ye shes kyi 'od zer phog pas de dag la phan 'dogs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Because after that, even the bodies of sentient beings whose mindstreams are certain to go to the lower realms are benefited by the light rays of the wisdom sun of the tathagatas shining on them.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu yang dag par bskyed pas na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu yang dag par bskyed pas na /
translated: And because they generate the causes for the future,

original: dge ba'i chos rnams kyis rnam par 'phel bar yang 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams kyis rnam par 'phel bar yang 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: they will increase in virtuous qualities.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is said.

original: log sred can gtan yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni theg pa chen po'i chos la sdang ba log sred can nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: log sred can gtan yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni theg pa chen po'i chos la sdang ba log sred can nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: What is said about those with wrong craving who are destined never to attain nirvana is said with a different time in mind, because the cause of being one with wrong craving who hates the Mahayana teachings is

original: theg pa chen po'i chos la sdang ba bzlog ba'i don du /🔽dus gzhan la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos la sdang ba bzlog ba'i don du / dus gzhan la dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the avoidance of the Mahayana teachings.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i rigs yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i rigs yod pa'i phyir /
translated: And it is said that because they have the naturally pure potential,

original: 'ga' yang gtan rnam par dag par mi 'gyur ba ni 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' yang gtan rnam par dag par mi 'gyur ba ni 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not right that some would never be fit for complete purification.🔽Because the Lord, intending that all sentient beings without distinction have the possibility of complete purification,

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis khyad par med par sems can thams cad la rnam par dag par rung ba nyid yod pa la dgongs nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis khyad par med par sems can thams cad la rnam par dag par rung ba nyid yod pa la dgongs nas /
translated: said:

original: thog med gyur kyang tham dang ldan pa //
analyzed: thog med gyur kyang tham dang ldan pa //
translated: Though beginningless, it is endowed with an end.

original: rang bzhin gyis dag rtag pa'i chos can ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dag rtag pa'i chos can ni //
translated: It has a pure nature, and is a permanent phenomenon.

original: thog med sbubs kyis phyi bsgribs mi mthong ste //
analyzed: thog med sbubs kyis phyi bsgribs mi mthong ste //
translated: It is not seen because it is obscured by beginningless sheaths,

original: ji ltar gser gyi gzugs ni bsgribs pa bzhin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar gser gyi gzugs ni bsgribs pa bzhin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: just like a golden statue that is covered.

original: de la ldan pa'i don las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: de la ldan pa'i don las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: In this regard, beginning from the meaning of endowment, there is a verse:

original: rgya mtsho che bzhin dpag med pa'i //🔽yon tan rin chen mi zad gnas //
analyzed: rgya mtsho che bzhin dpag med pa'i // yon tan rin chen mi zad gnas //
translated: Like the great ocean, it is the inexhaustible abode🔽of immeasurable jewels of good qualities.

original: dbyer med yon tan dang ldan pa'i //
analyzed: dbyer med yon tan dang ldan pa'i //
translated: It is endowed with inseparable good qualities,

original: ngo bo nyang phyir mar me bzhin //
analyzed: ngo bo nyang phyir mar me bzhin //
translated: and by nature is like a lamp.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa phyed snga mas ci ston zhe na /
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa phyed snga mas ci ston zhe na /
translated: What does the first half of the verse show?

original: chos sku rgyal ba'i ye shes dang // thugs rje'i khams ni bsdus pa'i phyir /🔽snod dang rin chen chu yis ni //
analyzed: chos sku rgyal ba'i ye shes dang // thugs rje'i khams ni bsdus pa'i phyir / snod dang rin chen chu yis ni //
translated: and the realm of compassion,

original: rgya mtsho dang ni mtshungs par bstan //
analyzed: rgya mtsho dang ni mtshungs par bstan //
translated: The ocean is compared to the universe, to jewels, and to water.

original: go rims ji lta bar gnas gsum po rnams kyi rgya mtsho chen bo dang chos mthun pa rnam pa gsum gyis na /
analyzed: go rims ji lta bar gnas gsum po rnams kyi rgya mtsho chen bo dang chos mthun pa rnam pa gsum gyis na /
translated: In the same order, the three realms are similar to the great ocean in three ways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams rgyu dang ldan pa'i dbang du byas te ldan pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams rgyu dang ldan pa'i dbang du byas te ldan pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the element of the Tathāgata should be understood as endowed with the meaning of endowment, from the point of view of its cause.

original: gnas gsum po gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnas gsum po gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the three realms?

original: chos kyi sku rnam par dag pa'i rgyu dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes thob pa'i rgyu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku rnam par dag pa'i rgyu dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes thob pa'i rgyu dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: They are the cause for the purification of the dharmakāya, the cause for attaining the wisdom of the buddhas, and the cause for engaging in the great compassion of the tathāgatas.

original: de la chos kyi sku rnam par dag pa'i rgyu ni theg pa chen po la mos pa sgom par @95a * //
analyzed: de la chos kyi sku rnam par dag pa'i rgyu ni theg pa chen po la mos pa sgom par @95a * //
translated: The cause for the purification of the dharmakāya should be seen as the cultivation of faith in the Great Vehicle.

original: blta'o // sangs rgyas kyi ye shes thob pa'i rgyu ni /
analyzed: blta'o // sangs rgyas kyi ye shes thob pa'i rgyu ni /
translated: The cause for attaining the wisdom of the buddhas is the cultivation of the perfections.

original: shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo sgom pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo sgom pa'o //
translated: and the cultivation of the doors of wisdom and concentration.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug pa'i rgyu ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po 'jug pa'i rgyu ni /
translated: The cause of the operation of the great compassion of the Tathagata is

original: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po sgom pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po sgom pa'o //
translated: the cultivation of the great compassion of the bodhisattva.

original: de la theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa sgom pa ni /
analyzed: de la theg pa chen po'i chos la mos pa sgom pa ni /
translated: Therein, the cultivation of the aspiration for the Dharma of the Great

original: snod dang chos mthun pa ste /
analyzed: snod dang chos mthun pa ste /
translated: Vehicle is similar to a vessel,

original: dpag tu med pa zad mi shes pa'i shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rin po che dang thugs rje'i chu rnams der 'du ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa zad mi shes pa'i shes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rin po che dang thugs rje'i chu rnams der 'du ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the jewel of the immeasurable and inexhaustible cognition and concentration and the water of compassion are contained therein.

original: shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo sgom pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo sgom pa ni /
translated: The cultivation of the doors of wisdom and concentration is

original: rin po che dang chos mthun pa ste /
analyzed: rin po che dang chos mthun pa ste /
translated: similar to a jewel,🔽because it is free from conceptual differentiation and possesses the

original: de ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir dang / mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: qualities of inconceivable power.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje sgom pa ni chu dang chos mthun pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje sgom pa ni chu dang chos mthun pa ste /
translated: The cultivation of the bodhisattva’s compassion is similar to water,🔽because it is the cause of the growth of the crop of the wholesome of all beings.

original: de ni 'gro ba thams cad la mchog tu brlan pa'i rang bzhin gyi ro gcig pa dang ldan pa'i phyi ro //
analyzed: de ni 'gro ba thams cad la mchog tu brlan pa'i rang bzhin gyi ro gcig pa dang ldan pa'i phyi ro //
translated: It is endowed with a single taste that is the supremely moistening nature for all beings.

original: chos gsum po de dag kyang rgyu gsum po 'dis de dang 'brel pa dang ldan pa ni ldan pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: chos gsum po de dag kyang rgyu gsum po 'dis de dang 'brel pa dang ldan pa ni ldan pa zhes brjod do //
translated: These three dharmas are said to be endowed with that which is connected with and possesses these three causes.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa phyed phyi mas ci bstan zhe na /
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa phyed phyi mas ci bstan zhe na /
translated: What is taught by the second half of the verse?

original: dri med gnas la mngon shes dang // ye shes dri med de nyid dang // rnam dbye med phyir mar me yi //
analyzed: dri med gnas la mngon shes dang // ye shes dri med de nyid dang // rnam dbye med phyir mar me yi //
translated: The stainless realm is endowed with the stainless superknowledges,

original: snang dang dro ma dog chos mtshungs can //
analyzed: snang dang dro ma dog chos mtshungs can //
translated: the light and warmth of the flame.

original: go rims ji lta bar gnas gsum po rnams kyi mar me dang chos mthun pa rnam pa gsum gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams la 'bras bu dang ldan pa'i dbang du byas te ldan pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: go rims ji lta bar gnas gsum po rnams kyi mar me dang chos mthun pa rnam pa gsum gyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams la 'bras bu dang ldan pa'i dbang du byas te ldan pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
translated: In accord with the order, the three dharmas are endowed with the Tathagata-garbha in the sense of possessing a result, by means of the three kinds of similarity to a flame.

original: gnas gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three realms?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mngon par shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa'i ye shes dang / zag pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang / zag pa zad pa'i ye shes dang / zag pa zad pa'o //
translated: the superknowledges, the knowledge of the destruction of the impurities, and the destruction of the impurities.

original: de la mngon par shes pa lnga ni snang ba dang chos mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: de la mngon par shes pa lnga ni snang ba dang chos mtshungs pa ste /
translated: The five superknowledges are similar to light,

original: de dag ni don nyams su myong ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mun pa 'joms pa nyid du nye bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro /🔽zag pa med pa'i ye shes ni /
analyzed: de dag ni don nyams su myong ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mun pa 'joms pa nyid du nye bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro / zag pa med pa'i ye shes ni /
translated: because they are characterized by the destruction of the darkness which is the resistance to the experience of their objects.

original: dro ba dang chos mthun ba ste /
analyzed: dro ba dang chos mthun ba ste /
translated: The uncontaminated intuition is similar to heat,

original: de la las dang nyon mongs pa'i bud shing ma lus pa sreg pa nye bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la las dang nyon mongs pa'i bud shing ma lus pa sreg pa nye bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is characterized by the presence of the burning up of all the fuel of karma and addictions.

original: gnas yongs su 'gyur ba'i zag pa zad pa ni mdog dang chos mthun pa ste /
analyzed: gnas yongs su 'gyur ba'i zag pa zad pa ni mdog dang chos mthun pa ste /
translated: The extinction of the contaminations through the revolution of the basis is similar to color,

original: de ni shin tu dri ma med @95b pa'i rnam par dag pa 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni shin tu dri ma med @95b pa'i rnam par dag pa 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is characterized by the extreme purity of stainlessness and brilliance.

original: de la dri ma med pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dri ma med pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, stainlessness is due to the elimination of the obscuration of the addictions.

original: rnam par dag pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Purity is due to the elimination of the obscuration of the knowable.

original: 'od gsal ba ni de gnyi ga glo bur ba nyid kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba ni de gnyi ga glo bur ba nyid kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The clear light is neither of these two, because its nature is not adventitious.

original: de ltar zag pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / ye shes dang spangs pas bsdus pa mi slob ba'i rgyud kyi chos bdun po 'di dag zag pa med pa'i dbyings na phan tshun rnam par dbye ba med pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar zag pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / ye shes dang spangs pas bsdus pa mi slob ba'i rgyud kyi chos bdun po 'di dag zag pa med pa'i dbyings na phan tshun rnam par dbye ba med pa ni /
translated: Thus, these seven dharmas of the stream of the adept, which are comprised of the uncontaminated superknowledges, the uncontaminated knowledges, and the uncontaminated relinquishments, are not mutually differentiated in the uncontaminated realm.

original: so so ma yin pa'i chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam pa nyid kyis ldan ba nyid ldan ba ni ldan pa zhes bya'o//
analyzed: so so ma yin pa'i chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam pa nyid kyis ldan ba nyid ldan ba ni ldan pa zhes bya'o//
translated: They are endowed with the equality of the non-discrete dharmadhatu. Endowed means endowed with.

original: lan pa'i don la brtsams pa'i dpe 'di ni rgyas par mdo ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: lan pa'i don la brtsams pa'i dpe 'di ni rgyas par mdo ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par bya ste /
translated: This example, which begins with the meaning of the word endowed, should be understood in detail according to the sutra.

original: sh'a ri'i bu dper na mar me ni 'di lta ste /🔽snang ba dang dro ba dang mdog dag gis sam /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu dper na mar me ni 'di lta ste / snang ba dang dro ba dang mdog dag gis sam /
translated: For example, Shariputra, a lamp is endowed with three things, namely:🔽light, heat, and color, or a jewel is endowed with three things, namely: light, color, and shape.

original: nor bu snang ba dang mdog dang dbyibs dag gis rnam par dbyer med pa'i chos can dang ma bral ba'i yon tan can no //
analyzed: nor bu snang ba dang mdog dang dbyibs dag gis rnam par dbyer med pa'i chos can dang ma bral ba'i yon tan can no //
translated: It is a dharma that is not differentiated, and it is endowed with inseparable qualities.

original: sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i chos kyi sku ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i chos kyi sku ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Śāriputra, in the same way, the dharmakāya of the Tathāgata’s teachings is like this.

original: gang ga'i klung gi bye ma snyed 'das pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos rnams kyis rnam par dbye ba med pa'i chos can ma bral ba'i ye shes kyi yon tan can no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang ga'i klung gi bye ma snyed 'das pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos rnams kyis rnam par dbye ba med pa'i chos can ma bral ba'i ye shes kyi yon tan can no zhes gsungs so //
translated: In the same way, Śāriputra, the Dharma body of the Tathāgata, which is taught, is not differentiated by the dharmas of the Tathāgatas, which are beyond the sands of the Ganges River, and is endowed with the quality of the wisdom that is not separated from the dharmas that are not differentiated.

original: de la 'jug pa'i don las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i don las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Here, beginning with the meaning of engagement, there is a verse:

original: so so'i skyes 'phags rdzogs sangs kyi //
analyzed: so so'i skyes 'phags rdzogs sangs kyi //
translated: The suchness of ordinary beings, the noble, and the perfect buddhas

original: de bzhin nyid dbye'i 'jug pa las //🔽de nyid gzigs pas sems can la //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dbye'i 'jug pa las // de nyid gzigs pas sems can la //
translated: Is the same in terms of engagement.🔽The one who sees that suchness

original: rgyal ba'i snying po 'di bstan no //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i snying po 'di bstan no //
translated: Has taught this essence of the victors to sentient beings.

original: 'dis ci bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis ci bstan zhe na /
translated: What is taught by this?

original: so so'i skye po phyin ci log /
analyzed: so so'i skye po phyin ci log /
translated: Ordinary beings are mistaken,

original: bden pa mthong ba bzlog pa ste //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba bzlog pa ste //
translated: And those who see the truth are the opposite.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ji lta bzhin //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ji lta bzhin //
translated: The tathāgatas are just as they are,

original: phyin ci ma log spros med nyid //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log spros med nyid //
translated: Unmistaken and free from elaborations.
