original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs par rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi sgo la gdams pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs par rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi sgo la gdams pa las brtsams te /
translated: In the same way, in the perfection of wisdom and so forth, the Tathagata's essence is taught to bodhisattvas in terms of the door of nonconceptual wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa spyi'i mtshan nyid bstan pa gang yin pa de la gang zag rnam pa gsum po de kho na ma mthong ba so so'i skye bo dang / de kho na mthong ba 'phags pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid rnam par dag pa spyi'i mtshan nyid bstan pa gang yin pa de la gang zag rnam pa gsum po de kho na ma mthong ba so so'i skye bo dang / de kho na mthong ba 'phags pa dang /
translated: The three kinds of persons are the ordinary beings who have not seen reality, the noble ones who have seen reality,

original: de kho na mthong ba rnam par dag pa'i mthar phyin pa de bzhi @96a * //
analyzed: de kho na mthong ba rnam par dag pa'i mthar phyin pa de bzhi @96a * //
translated: and the Tathagatas who have perfected the purification of seeing reality.

original: gshegs pa rnams kyi 'jug pa rnam pa gsum tha dad par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gshegs pa rnams kyi 'jug pa rnam pa gsum tha dad par rig par bya ste /
translated: The three kinds of engagement of those three kinds of persons should be understood as different.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: phyin ci log pa dang phyin ci ma log pa dang / yang dag par phyin ci ma log pa spros pa med pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log pa dang phyin ci ma log pa dang / yang dag par phyin ci ma log pa spros pa med pa ste /
translated: the erroneous, the nonerroneous, and the utterly nonerroneous without conceptual elaborations.

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are in that order.

original: de la phyin ci log ni byis pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: de la phyin ci log ni byis pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: The erroneous is that of the childish.

original: 'du shes dang sems dang lta ba phyin ci log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du shes dang sems dang lta ba phyin ci log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the perversion of ideation, thought, and view.

original: bzlog pas phyin ci ma log pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: bzlog pas phyin ci ma log pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: The non-perverted is that of the Aryans,

original: de spangs pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang dag par phyin ci ma log pa'i spros pa med pa ni /
analyzed: de spangs pa'i phyir ro // yang dag par phyin ci ma log pa'i spros pa med pa ni /
translated: because they have abandoned it.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi ste /
translated: The non-perverted of reality is that of the Perfectly Awakened Ones,

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have destroyed the afflictions and the obstructions to the knowable, together with their instincts.

original: 'di phan chad ni 'jug pa'i don nyid las brtsams te /
analyzed: 'di phan chad ni 'jug pa'i don nyid las brtsams te /
translated: From here on, the meaning of engagement is begun.

original: de las gzhan pa'i don rnam pa bzhi'i dbye ba ston par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i don rnam pa bzhi'i dbye ba ston par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the four kinds of distinctions of meaning are taught.

original: de la gang zag 'di gsum gyi gnas skabs kyi rab tu dbye ba las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa ;
analyzed: de la gang zag 'di gsum gyi gnas skabs kyi rab tu dbye ba las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa ;
translated: In this regard, beginning with the distinction of the states of these three persons, there is a verse:

original: / ma dag ma dag dag pa dang // shin tu rnam dag go rims bzhin //
analyzed: / ma dag ma dag dag pa dang // shin tu rnam dag go rims bzhin //
translated: Impure, impure-pure, and completely pure,

original: sems can byang chub sems dpa' dang // de bzhin gshegs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sems can byang chub sems dpa' dang // de bzhin gshegs pa zhes brjod do //
translated: are said to be the states of sentient beings, Bodhisattvas, and Tathagatas.

original: 'dis ci bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis ci bstan zhe na /
translated: What does this verse teach?

original: ngo bo nyid la sogs pa'i don //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la sogs pa'i don //
translated: The meaning of the essence and so on

original: 'di drug gis ni bsdus pa yi //🔽khams ni gnas skabs gsum dag tu //
analyzed: 'di drug gis ni bsdus pa yi // khams ni gnas skabs gsum dag tu //
translated: is included in these six.🔽The element is taught by three names

original: ming gsum gyis ni bstan pa nyid //🔽de ltar gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: ming gsum gyis ni bstan pa nyid // de ltar gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: in the three states.🔽Thus, whatever is taught by the Blessed One in many Dharma categories

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi chos kyi rnam grangs kyi sgo du mar rgyas par bstan pa'i zag pa med pa'i khams bstan pa ngo bo dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / las dang / ldan pa dang / 'jug pa'i don drug pa 'dis bsdus pa de thams cad ni mdor bsdus te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi chos kyi rnam grangs kyi sgo du mar rgyas par bstan pa'i zag pa med pa'i khams bstan pa ngo bo dang / rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / las dang / ldan pa dang / 'jug pa'i don drug pa 'dis bsdus pa de thams cad ni mdor bsdus te /
translated: as the uncontaminated element is included in this sixfold meaning of essence, cause, result, activity, endowment, and function.

original: gnas skabs gsum du go rims bzhin du ming gsum bstan pas bstan par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs gsum du go rims bzhin du ming gsum bstan pas bstan par rig par bya ste /
translated: All of that is summarized and should be understood as taught by the three names in the three states, respectively.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: ma dag pa'i gnas skabs su ni sems can gyi khams zhes bya ba dang / ma dag pa dang / dag pa'i gnas skabs su ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i gnas skabs su ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma dag pa'i gnas skabs su ni sems can gyi khams zhes bya ba dang / ma dag pa dang / dag pa'i gnas skabs su ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i gnas skabs su ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In the completely pure stage, it is called the Tathagata.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sh'a ri'i bu chos kyi sku de nyid nyon mongs pa'i sbus bye ba mtha' yas pas gtums pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sh'a ri'i bu chos kyi sku de nyid nyon mongs pa'i sbus bye ba mtha' yas pas gtums pas /
translated: The Lord said: Sariputra, that very Dharma body, wrapped in the myriads of afflictions,

original: 'khor @96b ba'i rgyun gyis khyer ba /
analyzed: 'khor @96b ba'i rgyun gyis khyer ba /
translated: carried away by the current of cyclic existence,

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i 'khor ba'i 'gro bar 'chi ba dang / snye ba dag tu 'khor ba ni sems can gyi khams zhes brjod do //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i 'khor ba'i 'gro bar 'chi ba dang / snye ba dag tu 'khor ba ni sems can gyi khams zhes brjod do //
translated: wandering in the cycle of birth and death in beginningless and endless cyclic existence, is called the element of sentient beings.

original: sh'a ri'i bu chos kyi sku de nyid 'khor ba'i rgyun gya sdug bsngal las skyo bar gyur pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu chos kyi sku de nyid 'khor ba'i rgyun gya sdug bsngal las skyo bar gyur pa /
translated: Sariputra, that very Dharma body, weary of the current of cyclic existence and suffering,

original: 'dod pa'i yul thams cad la chags pa dang bral ba pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i khongs su gtogs pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yul thams cad la chags pa dang bral ba pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i khongs su gtogs pa /
translated: free from attachment to all objects of desire, included within the ten perfections,

original: chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong gis byang chub kyi don du spyad pa spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes brjod do //
analyzed: chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong gis byang chub kyi don du spyad pa spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa' zhes brjod do //
translated: The one who practices the eighty-four thousand aggregates of the Dharma for the sake of awakening is called a bodhisattva.

original: sh'a ri'i bu chos kyi sku de nyid nyon mongs pa'i sbubs thams cad las yongs su grol ba /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu chos kyi sku de nyid nyon mongs pa'i sbubs thams cad las yongs su grol ba /
translated: Śāriputra, that very Dharma body, which is completely liberated from all the cocoons of afflictions,

original: sdug bsngal ba thams cad las 'das pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba thams cad las 'das pa /
translated: which has gone beyond all suffering,

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma mtha' dag dang bral ba /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma mtha' dag dang bral ba /
translated: which is free from all the stains of the secondary afflictions,

original: dag pa rnam par dag ba mchog tu yongs su dag pa'i chos nyid la gnas pa /
analyzed: dag pa rnam par dag ba mchog tu yongs su dag pa'i chos nyid la gnas pa /
translated: which abides in the nature of purity, complete purity, and supreme purity,

original: sems can thams cad kyis blta bar bya ba'i sa la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis blta bar bya ba'i sa la bzhugs pa /
translated: which is the ground to be seen by all sentient beings,

original: shes bya'i sa thams cad la gnyis su med pa'i skyes bu'i mthu thob pa /
analyzed: shes bya'i sa thams cad la gnyis su med pa'i skyes bu'i mthu thob pa /
translated: which has attained the nondual power of a person with regard to all the stages of knowledge,

original: sgrib pa med pa'i chos can chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug gi stobs thogs pa med pa thob pa ni /
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'i chos can chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug gi stobs thogs pa med pa thob pa ni /
translated: which is characterized by the absence of obscurations, which has attained the unobstructed power of sovereignty over all phenomena,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes brjod do //
translated: is called the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One.

original: zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: As it is said.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams gnas skabs gsum po de dag nyid du thams cad du 'gro ba'i don las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /🔽ji ltar rtogs med bdag nyid can //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams gnas skabs gsum po de dag nyid du thams cad du 'gro ba'i don las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa / ji ltar rtogs med bdag nyid can //
translated: In terms of the meaning of the all-pervadingness of the tathiigatagarbha in these three states, there is a verse:

original: nam mkha' kun tu rjes song ltar //
analyzed: nam mkha' kun tu rjes song ltar //
translated: Just as space is omnipresent🔽In all forms, good, bad, and neutral,

original: sems kyi rang bzhin dri med dbyings //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin dri med dbyings //
translated: So is the stainless realm of mind

original: de bzhin kun tu 'gro ba nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin kun tu 'gro ba nyid //
translated: Omnipresent in all beings.

original: 'di ci bstan zhe na ;🔽de'i spyi'i mtshan nyid nyes pa dang // yon tan mthar thug khyab pa ste //
analyzed: 'di ci bstan zhe na ; de'i spyi'i mtshan nyid nyes pa dang // yon tan mthar thug khyab pa ste //
translated: What is this teaching?🔽Its universal characteristic is the pervasion of the ultimate🔽Faults and virtues, just as space pervades

original: gzugs kyi rnam pa dman pa dang // bar ma mchog la nam mkha' bzhin //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam pa dman pa dang // bar ma mchog la nam mkha' bzhin //
translated: All forms, good, bad, and neutral.

original: so so'i skye bo dang / 'phags pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi sems kyi rang bzhin rnam par mi rtog pa gang yin pa de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir nyes pa dang / yon tan dang / yon tan rnam par dag pa mthar thug pa'i gnas skabs gsum gar yang rjes su song ba /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang / 'phags pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi sems kyi rang bzhin rnam par mi rtog pa gang yin pa de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir nyes pa dang / yon tan dang / yon tan rnam par dag pa mthar thug pa'i gnas skabs gsum gar yang rjes su song ba /
translated: The nature of the mind of ordinary beings, āryas, and perfect buddhas is nonconceptual, and because it is the general characteristic, it is present in all three states: the state of faults, the state of pure qualities, and the state of the ultimate perfection of qualities.

original: rjes su zhugs pa /
analyzed: rjes su zhugs pa /
translated: It is present in all three states,

original: mtshungs pa / dus thams cad du khyad par med par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: mtshungs pa / dus thams cad du khyad par med par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: it is the same, and it is without distinction at all times.

original: @97a * // go rims ji lta bzhin sa dang / zangs dang / gser gyi snod kyi nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: @97a * // go rims ji lta bzhin sa dang / zangs dang / gser gyi snod kyi nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: This is like the space in clay pots, copper pots, and golden pots, respectively.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gnas skabs bstan pa'i de ma thag tu /🔽sh'a ri'i bu de'i phyir na sems can gyi khams kyang gzhan la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gnas skabs bstan pa'i de ma thag tu / sh'a ri'i bu de'i phyir na sems can gyi khams kyang gzhan la /
translated: Therefore, immediately after the teaching on the states,

original: chos kyi sku yang gzhan pa ni ma yin te sems can gyi khams nyid chos kyi sku //
analyzed: chos kyi sku yang gzhan pa ni ma yin te sems can gyi khams nyid chos kyi sku //
translated: Śāriputra, therefore the realm of sentient beings is not one thing and the dharmakāya another. The realm of sentient beings is the dharmakāya.

original: chos kyi sku nyid kyang sems can gyi khams te /
analyzed: chos kyi sku nyid kyang sems can gyi khams te /
translated: The dharmakaya itself is the realm of sentient beings.

original: 'di ni don gyis gnyis su med de yi ge tsam dang tha dad par yin no zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni don gyis gnyis su med de yi ge tsam dang tha dad par yin no zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: This is the ultimate nonduality, which is only a matter of syllables, a matter of words.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams gnas skabs gsum po 'di thams cad du song ba yin yang de kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang pa dag gis mi 'gyur ba'i don las brtsams te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams gnas skabs gsum po 'di thams cad du song ba yin yang de kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang pa dag gis mi 'gyur ba'i don las brtsams te /
translated: The tathiigatagarbha is present in all three states, but in terms of the fact that it is not changed by the addictions and by purification,

original: tshigs su bcad pa bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bcu bzhi'o //
translated: there are fourteen verses.

original: 'di ni de dag gi bsdus pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de dag gi bsdus pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
translated: This is to be understood as the summary meaning of those verses.🔽Because of possessing adventitious faults

original: nyes pa'i glo bur dang ldan dang // yon tan rang bzhin nyid ldan phyir //
analyzed: nyes pa'i glo bur dang ldan dang // yon tan rang bzhin nyid ldan phyir //
translated: and because of possessing good qualities by nature,

original: ji ltar sngar bzhin phyis de bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar sngar bzhin phyis de bzhin //
translated: It is just as it was before and just as it will be later.

original: 'gyur ba med pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: This is the unchanging reality.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bcu gnyis dang // gcig gis ni go rims bzhin du ma dag pa'i gnas skabs dang / ma dag pa dang dag pa'i gnas skabs na nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dag glo bur ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dang /🔽tshigs su bcad pa bcu bzhi pas ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i gnas skabs na rnam par dbye ba med cing bral mi shes shing /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bcu gnyis dang // gcig gis ni go rims bzhin du ma dag pa'i gnas skabs dang / ma dag pa dang dag pa'i gnas skabs na nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dag glo bur ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / tshigs su bcad pa bcu bzhi pas ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i gnas skabs na rnam par dbye ba med cing bral mi shes shing /
translated: The twelve verses and one verse respectively show that in the impure stage and in the impure-pure stage, the dharmadhatu is endowed with adventitious afflictions and secondary afflictions.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab la /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab la /
translated: The fourteenth verse shows that in the completely pure stage, it is inseparable and undifferentiable, inconceivable,🔽and endowed by nature with the qualities of the Buddha beyond the number of the sands of the Ganges river.

original: gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snying las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos dang rang bzhin gyis ldan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams nam mkha'i bzhin snga ma dang phyi mar gtan 'gyur ba med par bstan to //
analyzed: gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snying las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos dang rang bzhin gyis ldan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams nam mkha'i bzhin snga ma dang phyi mar gtan 'gyur ba med par bstan to //
translated: Thus, the dharmadhatu of the Tathagata is like space, unchanging in the past and future.

original: de la ma dag pa'i gnas skabs na 'gyur ba med pa'i mtshan nyid las brtsams pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bcu gnyis po gang dag ce na /
analyzed: de la ma dag pa'i gnas skabs na 'gyur ba med pa'i mtshan nyid las brtsams pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bcu gnyis po gang dag ce na /
translated: What are the twelve verses that begin with the characteristic of immutability in the impure stage?

original: ji ltar nam mkha' kun songs ba //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' kun songs ba //
translated: Just as space is all-pervading,

original: phra phyir nye bar gos pa med //
analyzed: phra phyir nye bar gos pa med //
translated: subtle, and unstained,🔽so is this abiding nature

original: de bzhin sems can thams cad la //🔽gnas 'di nye bar gos ba med //
analyzed: de bzhin sems can thams cad la // gnas 'di nye bar gos ba med //
translated: in all sentient beings.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten thams cad du //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten thams cad du //
translated: Just as in all worlds🔽space is born and ceases,

original: nam mkha' la ni skye zhing 'jig / de bzhin 'dus ma byas dbyings la //🔽dbang po rnams ni skye zhing 'jig / ji ltar nam mkha' me @97b rnams kyis //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni skye zhing 'jig / de bzhin 'dus ma byas dbyings la // dbang po rnams ni skye zhing 'jig / ji ltar nam mkha' me @97b rnams kyis //
translated: so in the uncompounded realm🔽the faculties are born and cease.🔽Just as space is never burned

original: sngon chad nam yang tshig pa med //
analyzed: sngon chad nam yang tshig pa med //
translated: by the fires at the world’s end,🔽so too is this realm

original: de bzhin 'di ni 'chi ba dang // na dang rga ba'i mes mi 'tshig / sa ni chu la chu rlung la //🔽rlung ni mkha' la rab tu gnas //
analyzed: de bzhin 'di ni 'chi ba dang // na dang rga ba'i mes mi 'tshig / sa ni chu la chu rlung la // rlung ni mkha' la rab tu gnas //
translated: not burned by the fires of death, sickness, and aging.🔽Earth rests on water, water on wind,🔽and wind rests on space,

original: mkha'i ni rlung dang chu dag dang // sa yi khams la gnas ma yin //
analyzed: mkha'i ni rlung dang chu dag dang // sa yi khams la gnas ma yin //
translated: but space does not rest on these three.

original: de bzhin phung po khams dbang rnams //🔽las dang nyon mongs dag la gnas //🔽las dang nyon mongs tshul bzhin min //
analyzed: de bzhin phung po khams dbang rnams // las dang nyon mongs dag la gnas // las dang nyon mongs tshul bzhin min //
translated: Likewise, the aggregates and elements rest on the sense faculties,🔽and the sense faculties rest on karma and afflictions,

original: yid la byed la rtag tu gnas //
analyzed: yid la byed la rtag tu gnas //
translated: but karma and afflictions always rest on

original: tshul bzhin ma yin yid byed ni //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin yid byed ni //
translated: improper mental activity.🔽Improper mental activity

original: sems kyi dag pa la rab gnas //🔽sems kyi rang bzhin chos rnams ni //
analyzed: sems kyi dag pa la rab gnas // sems kyi rang bzhin chos rnams ni //
translated: And is well-established in the purity of mind.🔽The nature of mind is not present

original: thams cad la yang gnas pa med //
analyzed: thams cad la yang gnas pa med //
translated: In any of the phenomena.🔽The aggregates, sense spheres, and components

original: sa dang 'dra bar phung po dang // skye mched khams rnams shes par bya //🔽chu khams dang 'dra lus can gyi //
analyzed: sa dang 'dra bar phung po dang // skye mched khams rnams shes par bya // chu khams dang 'dra lus can gyi //
translated: Should be known to be like the earth.🔽The karma and afflictions of embodied beings

original: las dang nyon mongs shes bya ste //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs shes bya ste //
translated: Are like the water component.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin yid byed ni //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin yid byed ni //
translated: Incorrect mental activity

original: rlung gi khams dang 'dra bar blta //
analyzed: rlung gi khams dang 'dra bar blta //
translated: Should be seen as like the wind component.

original: rang bzhin nam mkha'i khams bzhin du //
analyzed: rang bzhin nam mkha'i khams bzhin du //
translated: The nature is like the space component,

original: de bzhin can min gnas pa med //
analyzed: de bzhin can min gnas pa med //
translated: Not being such, and not being present.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin yid byed ni //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin yid byed ni //
translated: Incorrect mental activity

original: sems kyi rang bzhin la gnas te //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin la gnas te //
translated: Rests on the nature of mind.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin yid byed kyis //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin yid byed kyis //
translated: Incorrect mental activity

original: las dang nyon mongs rab tu phye //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs rab tu phye //
translated: Distinguishes karma and afflictions.

original: las dang nyon mongs chu las ni //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs chu las ni //
translated: From the water of karma and afflictions

original: phung po skye mched khams rnams 'byung //
analyzed: phung po skye mched khams rnams 'byung //
translated: The aggregates, sense spheres, and components arise.

original: de 'jig pa dang 'chags pa ltar //
analyzed: de 'jig pa dang 'chags pa ltar //
translated: Just as it is destroyed and formed,

original: skye dang 'jig par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: It is subject to arising and destruction.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin nam mkha'i yi //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin nam mkha'i yi //
translated: The nature of mind is like the sky.

original: khams ltar rgyu med rkyen med de //
analyzed: khams ltar rgyu med rkyen med de //
translated: Like the elements, it is without cause or condition.🔽It has no collection, no arising,

original: tshogs pa med cing skye ba dang // 'jig dang gnas pa'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: tshogs pa med cing skye ba dang // 'jig dang gnas pa'ang yod ma yin //
translated: no destruction, and no abiding.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal gang yin pa //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal gang yin pa //
translated: The nature of mind is clear light,

original: de ni nam mkha' bzhin du 'gyur med de //
analyzed: de ni nam mkha' bzhin du 'gyur med de //
translated: unchanging like space.

original: yang dag min rtogs las byung 'dod chags sogs //
analyzed: yang dag min rtogs las byung 'dod chags sogs //
translated: Desire and so forth arise from incorrect conception,

original: glo bur dri mas de nyon mongs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: glo bur dri mas de nyon mongs mi 'gyur //
translated: but the mind is not defiled by adventitious stains.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' dpe 'dis ma dag pa'i gnas skabs na de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i tshogs nyid du bstan pa de brjod pa ni //🔽las dang nyon mongs chu sogs kyis //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' dpe 'dis ma dag pa'i gnas skabs na de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i tshogs nyid du bstan pa de brjod pa ni // las dang nyon mongs chu sogs kyis //
translated: This example of space illustrates how the essence of the tathagatas remains unchanged throughout the impure phase.🔽It is not created by karma and afflictions,

original: 'di ni mngon par 'grub min te //
analyzed: 'di ni mngon par 'grub min te //
translated: by water and so forth.🔽It is not burned by the unbearable fires

original: 'chi dang na dang rga ba'i me //🔽mi bzad pas kyang tshig mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'chi dang na dang rga ba'i me // mi bzad pas kyang tshig mi 'gyur //
translated: of death, sickness, and aging.

original: ji ltar tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor las byung pa /
analyzed: ji ltar tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor las byung pa /
translated: The essence of the tathagatas is not created by the wind mandala that arises from incorrect mental activity.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i chu la brten nas /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i chu la brten nas /
translated: It is not created by the water of karma and afflictions.

original: @98a * // phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi 'jig rten skyes bas sems kyi rang bzhin gyi nam mkha' 'chags par 'gyur ba ma yin pa bzhin du tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / las dang nyon mongs pa'i rlung dang chu'i phung po la gnas pa /
analyzed: @98a * // phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi 'jig rten skyes bas sems kyi rang bzhin gyi nam mkha' 'chags par 'gyur ba ma yin pa bzhin du tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / las dang nyon mongs pa'i rlung dang chu'i phung po la gnas pa /
translated: Just as the space of the nature of mind is not created by the formation of the world of the aggregates, elements, and sense spheres,

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi 'jig rten 'jig par byed pa /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi 'jig rten 'jig par byed pa /
translated: so it should be understood that it is not destroyed by the destruction of the world of the aggregates, elements, and sense spheres, which is brought about by the wind and water of karma and afflictions that are based on incorrect mental activity.

original: 'chi ba dang na dang rga ba'i me'i tshogs skyes pas kyang de mi 'jig par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba dang na dang rga ba'i me'i tshogs skyes pas kyang de mi 'jig par rig par bya'o //
translated: Nor is it destroyed by the arising of the mass of the fire of death, sickness, and aging.

original: de ltar ma dag pa'i gnas skabs na snod kyi 'jig rten bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang / las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa mtha' dag skye ba dang 'jig kyang /
analyzed: de ltar ma dag pa'i gnas skabs na snod kyi 'jig rten bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang / las dang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa mtha' dag skye ba dang 'jig kyang /
translated: Thus, in the impure state, just like the world of the container, the afflictions, karma, and birth of the entire affliction are created and destroyed.

original: 'dus ma byas ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni nam mkha' bzhin du skye ba med cing 'gag pa med ba shin tu mi 'gyur ba'i chos nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni nam mkha' bzhin du skye ba med cing 'gag pa med ba shin tu mi 'gyur ba'i chos nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The unconditioned essence of the Tathagata is taught to be like space, unborn and unceasing, the utterly unchanging reality.

original: ring bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i sgo'i chos snang ba'i sgo las brtsams pa /
analyzed: ring bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i sgo'i chos snang ba'i sgo las brtsams pa /
translated: The Dharma-illumination door that begins with the door of gradual purification

original: nam mkha'i dpe 'di rgyas par ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dpe 'di rgyas par ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par bya ste /
translated: This example of space should be understood in detail according to the sutra.

original: drang srong chen po nyon mongs pa ni mun pa /
analyzed: drang srong chen po nyon mongs pa ni mun pa /
translated: Great Sage, afflictions are darkness;

original: rnam par dag pa ni snang ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ni snang ba'o //
translated: purification is illumination.

original: nyon mongs pa ni stobs chung ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni stobs chung ba /
translated: Afflictions are weak;

original: lhag mthong ni stobs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong ni stobs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: insight is powerful.

original: nyon mongs pa ni glo bur pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni glo bur pa /
translated: Afflictions are adventitious;

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa ni rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa ni rtsa ba'o //
translated: natural purity is the root.

original: nyon mongs pa ni kun tu brtags pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni kun tu brtags pa /
translated: Afflictions are imputed;

original: rang bzhin ni kun tu ma brtags pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni kun tu ma brtags pa'o //
translated: nature is un-imputed.

original: drang srong chen po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: drang srong chen po 'di lta ste /
translated: Great Sage, it is like this:

original: sa chen po 'di ni chu la rab tu gnas pa /
analyzed: sa chen po 'di ni chu la rab tu gnas pa /
translated: this great earth is well-established on water;

original: chu ni rlung la rab tu gnas pa /🔽rlung ni nam mkha' la rab tu gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: chu ni rlung la rab tu gnas pa / rlung ni nam mkha' la rab tu gnas pa yin la /
translated: Water is based on wind.🔽Wind is based on space.

original: nam mkha' ni gnas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni gnas pa med pa'o //
translated: Space is not based on anything.

original: de bzhin du khams bzhi po 'di rnams las /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams bzhi po 'di rnams las /
translated: In the same way, among these four elements,

original: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / rlung gi khams pas ni nam mkha'i khams nyid stobs dang ldan pa /🔽brtan pa / mi g-yo ba /
analyzed: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / rlung gi khams pas ni nam mkha'i khams nyid stobs dang ldan pa / brtan pa / mi g-yo ba /
translated: the element of space is the most powerful,

original: 'grib pa med pa /
analyzed: 'grib pa med pa /
translated: the most stable, the most enduring,🔽the most unchanging,

original: skye ba med pa /
analyzed: skye ba med pa /
translated: the most unborn,

original: 'gag pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa ste /
translated: the most unceasing,

original: rang gi dang gis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi dang gis gnas pa'o //
translated: and the most naturally abiding.

original: de la khams gsum po gang yin pa de dag ni skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de la khams gsum po gang yin pa de dag ni skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa /
translated: Among them, the three elements of earth, water, and wind are subject to arising and destruction,

original: mi gnas pa yun ring du mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: mi gnas pa yun ring du mi gnas pa ste /
translated: unstable, and not enduring.

original: 'di dag la ni rnam par 'gyur pa mthong gi / nam mkha'i la ni rnam par 'gyur ba 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'di dag la ni rnam par 'gyur pa mthong gi / nam mkha'i la ni rnam par 'gyur ba 'ga' yang med do //
translated: They are seen to change, but space does not change at all.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: @98b phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dag ni las dang nyon mongs pa la rab tu gnas pa'o //
analyzed: @98b phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dag ni las dang nyon mongs pa la rab tu gnas pa'o //
translated: the aggregates, elements, and sense bases are based on karma and mental afflictions.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la rab tu gnas pa /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la rab tu gnas pa /
translated: Karma and afflictions are based on incorrect mental activity.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa la gnas pa ste /
translated: Incorrect mental activity is based on natural purity.

original: des na sems kyi rang bzhin ni 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: des na sems kyi rang bzhin ni 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the nature of mind is clear light.

original: glo bur gyi nyon mongs pas nyon ma mongs pa'o zhes brjod do zhe'o //
analyzed: glo bur gyi nyon mongs pas nyon ma mongs pa'o zhes brjod do zhe'o //
translated: It is said to be unafflicted by adventitious afflictions.

original: de la tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa dang / las dang nyon mongs pa gang yin pa dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched gang yin pa'i chos 'di mtha' dag ni rgyu rkyen gyis bsdus pas skye ba rgyu rkyen dang bral na 'gag par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa gang yin pa dang / las dang nyon mongs pa gang yin pa dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched gang yin pa'i chos 'di mtha' dag ni rgyu rkyen gyis bsdus pas skye ba rgyu rkyen dang bral na 'gag par 'gyur gyi /
translated: In this regard, all these phenomena—incorrect mental activity, karma and afflictions, and the aggregates, elements, and sense bases—are produced by causes and conditions. If one is separated from causes and conditions, they cease.

original: rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni rgyu med pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni rgyu med pa /
translated: However, the nature is without cause,

original: rkyen med pa /
analyzed: rkyen med pa /
translated: without conditions,

original: tshogs pa med pa /
analyzed: tshogs pa med pa /
translated: without a collection,

original: skye ba med pa /
analyzed: skye ba med pa /
translated: without production,

original: 'gag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa'o //
translated: and without cessation.

original: de la nam mkha'i khams ji lta pa de ltar ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la nam mkha'i khams ji lta pa de ltar ni rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature is like the space element.

original: rlung gi khams ji lta ba de ltar ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: rlung gi khams ji lta ba de ltar ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Improper mental activity is like the wind element.

original: chu'i khams ji ta ba de ltar ni las dang nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i khams ji ta ba de ltar ni las dang nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Karma and afflictions are like the water element.

original: sa'i khams ji lta ba de ltar ni phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams rnams so //
analyzed: sa'i khams ji lta ba de ltar ni phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams rnams so //
translated: The aggregates, sense spheres, and elements are like the earth element.

original: des na chos thams cad ni rtsa ba yongs su chad pa ste /
analyzed: des na chos thams cad ni rtsa ba yongs su chad pa ste /
translated: Therefore, all phenomena are said to have their root cut off,

original: snying po med pa'i rtsa ba can /
analyzed: snying po med pa'i rtsa ba can /
translated: to have a root of no essence,

original: mi gnas pa'i rtsa ba can /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i rtsa ba can /
translated: to have a root of no abiding,

original: dag pa'i rtsa ba can /
analyzed: dag pa'i rtsa ba can /
translated: to have a root of purity,

original: rtsa ba med pa'i rtsa ba can zhes brjod do zhe'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba med pa'i rtsa ba can zhes brjod do zhe'o //
translated: to have a root of no root.

original: ma dag pa'i nas skabs na /
analyzed: ma dag pa'i nas skabs na /
translated: In the impure part,

original: 'gyur ba med pa'i mtshan nyid las brtsams te /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa'i mtshan nyid las brtsams te /
translated: starting from the characteristic of immutability,

original: rang bzhin nam mkha' dang chos mtshungs pa dang / de la brten pa tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / las dang nyon mongs pa rnams rgyu'i mtshan nyid las brtsams nas /
analyzed: rang bzhin nam mkha' dang chos mtshungs pa dang / de la brten pa tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / las dang nyon mongs pa rnams rgyu'i mtshan nyid las brtsams nas /
translated: The nature of the aggregates is similar to space.

original: rlung gi khams dang chos mtshungs pa dang / chu'i khams dang chos mtshungs pa dang / de las byung ba phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnam par smin pa'i mtshan nyid las brtsams te /
analyzed: rlung gi khams dang chos mtshungs pa dang / chu'i khams dang chos mtshungs pa dang / de las byung ba phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnam par smin pa'i mtshan nyid las brtsams te /
translated: The cause of the aggregates is similar to the wind element, the water element, and the fire element.🔽The result of the aggregates is similar to the earth element.🔽The cause of the aggregates is similar to the wind element, the water element, and the fire element.

original: sa'i khams dang chos mtshungs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: sa'i khams dang chos mtshungs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The result of the aggregates is similar to the earth element.🔽The destruction of the aggregates is similar to the fire element.

original: de 'jig pa'i rgyu'i 'chi ba dang / na ba dang / rga ba'i me ga'i nad kyi mtshan nyid las brtsams te me'i khams dang chos mtshungs pa ni ma @99a * //🔽bshad pas na de brjod pa //🔽dus mtha' dmyal ba tha mal pa'i //
analyzed: de 'jig pa'i rgyu'i 'chi ba dang / na ba dang / rga ba'i me ga'i nad kyi mtshan nyid las brtsams te me'i khams dang chos mtshungs pa ni ma @99a * // bshad pas na de brjod pa // dus mtha' dmyal ba tha mal pa'i //
translated: The three fires of death, sickness, and aging are the causes of the destruction of the aggregates.

original: me gsum 'chi dang na ba dang // rga ba'i me gsum rim bzhin du //
analyzed: me gsum 'chi dang na ba dang // rga ba'i me gsum rim bzhin du //
translated: The three fires of the end of the eon, the hell of Ultimate Torment, and ordinary fire are similar to the fire element.🔽The three fires of death, sickness, and aging are similar to the fire element.

original: de dang 'dra bar shes par bya //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar shes par bya //
translated: It should be understood in the same way.

original: 'chi ba dang / na ba dang / rga ba rnams ni go rims bzhin du rgyu gsum gyis me dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba dang / na ba dang / rga ba rnams ni go rims bzhin du rgyu gsum gyis me dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
translated: Death, sickness, and aging should be understood as being like fire, respectively, in terms of three causes.

original: skye mched drug bdag gi ba med par byed pa dang / sdug bsngal sna tshogs myong bar byed pa dang / 'du byed yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched drug bdag gi ba med par byed pa dang / sdug bsngal sna tshogs myong bar byed pa dang / 'du byed yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They cause the six sense spheres to be without a self; they cause the experience of various kinds of suffering; and they cause the maturation of the formative forces.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams ma dag pa'i gnas skabs na yang 'chi ba dang / na ba dang / rga ba'i me gsum po 'di dag gis mi 'gyur ba nyid las brtsams te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams ma dag pa'i gnas skabs na yang 'chi ba dang / na ba dang / rga ba'i me gsum po 'di dag gis mi 'gyur ba nyid las brtsams te /
translated: Even in the impure stage, the element of the Tathāgata is not subject to these three fires of death, sickness, and aging.

original: 'di skad ces /
analyzed: 'di skad ces /
translated: In this regard, it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das 'chi ba zhes bgyi ba dang / skye ba zhes bgyi ba 'di ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'chi ba zhes bgyi ba dang / skye ba zhes bgyi ba 'di ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad do //
translated: “Lord, death and birth are worldly conventions.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'chi ba zhes bgyi ba 'di ni dbang po 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'chi ba zhes bgyi ba 'di ni dbang po 'gags pa'o //
translated: Lord, death is the cessation of the faculties.

original: bcom ldan 'das skye ba zhes bgyi ba 'di ni dbang po gsar pa rnams thob pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das skye ba zhes bgyi ba 'di ni dbang po gsar pa rnams thob pa'o //
translated: Lord, birth is the acquisition of new faculties.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni skye ba'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni skye ba'am /
translated: The Tathāgata essence, Blessed One, is not born,

original: 'chi 'pho ba'am /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba'am /
translated: does not die,

original: skye ba ma lags so //
analyzed: skye ba ma lags so //
translated: does not become reborn.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyi yul las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid kyi yul las 'das pa ste /
translated: The Tathāgata essence, Blessed One, is beyond the domain of the characteristics of the conditioned,

original: rtag pa / brtan ba /
analyzed: rtag pa / brtan ba /
translated: permanent, stable,

original: zhi ba / g-yung drung ngo zhes gsungs so //🔽de la ma dag pa dang dag pa'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: zhi ba / g-yung drung ngo zhes gsungs so // de la ma dag pa dang dag pa'i gnas skabs na /
translated: eternal, and a refuge.

original: 'gyur ba med pa las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa las brtsams te tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: In this regard, the verse on the topic of immutability in the impure and pure states is:

original: skye 'chi na dang rga ba las grol ba //
analyzed: skye 'chi na dang rga ba las grol ba //
translated: Liberated from birth, death, sickness, and old age,

original: 'di yi rang bzhin ji bzhin nyid rtogs te //
analyzed: 'di yi rang bzhin ji bzhin nyid rtogs te //
translated: the wise realize the suchness of its nature.

original: skye sogs phongs dang bral yang de yi rgyus //
analyzed: skye sogs phongs dang bral yang de yi rgyus //
translated: Though free from the troubles of birth, etc., they rely on it

original: blo ldan 'gro la snying rje bskyed phyir bsten //
analyzed: blo ldan 'gro la snying rje bskyed phyir bsten //
translated: out of compassion for the world.

original: 'dis ci bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis ci bstan zhe na /
translated: What does this verse show?🔽The noble ones have completely abandoned

original: 'phags pas 'chi dang na ba dang // rga ba'i sdug bsngal rtsad nas spangs //
analyzed: 'phags pas 'chi dang na ba dang // rga ba'i sdug bsngal rtsad nas spangs //
translated: the sufferings of death, sickness, and old age.

original: las dang nyon mongs dbang gis skye //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs dbang gis skye //
translated: They are born through the power of karma and afflictions.

original: de la de med phyis de med //
analyzed: de la de med phyis de med //
translated: When that is absent, that is absent.

original: ma dag pa'i gnas skabs kyi 'chi ba dang na ba dang / rga ba'i me 'di'i bud shing lta bu'i nye bar len pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / las dang nyon mongs pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi skye ba yin te /
analyzed: ma dag pa'i gnas skabs kyi 'chi ba dang na ba dang / rga ba'i me 'di'i bud shing lta bu'i nye bar len pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / las dang nyon mongs pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi skye ba yin te /
translated: The fuel for the fire of death, sickness, and aging in the impure stage is the appropriation that is the basis of the fire, which is improper mentation and birth that is preceded by karma and afflictions.

original: ma dag pa dang dag pa'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: ma dag pa dang dag pa'i gnas skabs na /
translated: In the impure and pure stages,

original: yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gang @99b zhig shin tu snang bar med par gyur pas cig shos gtan 'bar ba med par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gang @99b zhig shin tu snang bar med par gyur pas cig shos gtan 'bar ba med par rtogs pa'o //
translated: the bodhisattvas who have attained the mental body realize that when one is completely absent, the other is also completely absent.

original: ji bzhin yang dag mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: ji bzhin yang dag mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: Because they see reality just as it is,

original: skye sogs rnams las 'das gyur kyang //
analyzed: skye sogs rnams las 'das gyur kyang //
translated: they transcend birth and so on,🔽but because of their compassionate nature,

original: snying rje'i bdag nyid skye ba dang // 'chi dang rga dang na bar ston //
analyzed: snying rje'i bdag nyid skye ba dang // 'chi dang rga dang na bar ston //
translated: they demonstrate birth, death, aging, and sickness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i srid pa kun tu sbyor ba can te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i srid pa kun tu sbyor ba can te /
translated: Bodhisattvas are bound to existence by the roots of virtue.

original: bsams bzhin du skye ba la dbang ba nyid la brten nas snying rjes khams gsum du yang dag par sbyor ro //
analyzed: bsams bzhin du skye ba la dbang ba nyid la brten nas snying rjes khams gsum du yang dag par sbyor ro //
translated: And on the basis of mastery over birth, he is born intentionally, and out of compassion, he is born in the three realms.

original: skye ba yang nye bar ston la /
analyzed: skye ba yang nye bar ston la /
translated: He manifests birth,

original: rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba yang nye bar ston to //
analyzed: rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba yang nye bar ston to //
translated: and he manifests aging, sickness, and death.

original: de dag skye ba la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag kyang med de /
analyzed: de dag skye ba la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag kyang med de /
translated: But he has no birth, and so on.

original: khams de nyid skye ba med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams de nyid skye ba med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he sees those very elements as unborn and non-arisen, just as they are.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs 'di rgyas par ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin shes par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs 'di rgyas par ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin shes par bya ste /
translated: This stage of the bodhisattva should be understood in detail according to the sutra.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de dag gi 'khor ba'i rgyu dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pha gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi 'khor ba'i rgyu dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pha gang zhe na /
translated: What are the afflictions that are associated with the roots of virtue that are the cause of their cyclic existence?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su tshol bas mi ngoms pa dang / bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang / sangs rgyas dang phrad pa don du gnyer ba dang / sems can yongs su smin pa'i phyir mi skyo ba dang /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su tshol bas mi ngoms pa dang / bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa dang / sangs rgyas dang phrad pa don du gnyer ba dang / sems can yongs su smin pa'i phyir mi skyo ba dang /
translated: They are insatiable in seeking the collection of merit, they take up birth in existence as they wish, they strive to meet the buddhas, they are not discouraged in bringing sentient beings to full maturity,

original: dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa la brtson pa dang / sems can gyi bya ba ci yod pa la 'grus pa dang / chos la chags pa'i bsam pa dang ma bral ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba rnams mi 'dor ba ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yongs su 'dzin pa la brtson pa dang / sems can gyi bya ba ci yod pa la 'grus pa dang / chos la chags pa'i bsam pa dang ma bral ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba rnams mi 'dor ba ste /
translated: they are diligent in upholding the sublime Dharma, they are active in whatever needs to be done for sentient beings, they are never without the intention of being devoted to the Dharma, and they do not abandon the fetters of the perfections.

original: blo gros rgya mtsho gang dag gis byang chub sems dpa' kun tu sbyor bar byed kyang nyon mongs pa'i skyon gyis mi gos pa /
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho gang dag gis byang chub sems dpa' kun tu sbyor bar byed kyang nyon mongs pa'i skyon gyis mi gos pa /
translated: Sāgaramati, these are the fetters that cause bodhisattvas to be fettered, yet they are not sullied by the faults of affliction.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan ba'i nyon mongs pa ni 'di dag go //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan ba'i nyon mongs pa ni 'di dag go //
translated: These are the afflictions that are concomitant with the roots of virtue.

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /
translated: It also says:

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba la gsan /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe dge ba'i rtsa ba la gsan /
translated: Blessed One, when I hear about the roots of virtue,

original: de'i rgyu ci'i slad du nyon mongs pa zhes bgyi /
analyzed: de'i rgyu ci'i slad du nyon mongs pa zhes bgyi /
translated: What is the reason for calling them afflictions?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said:

original: blo gros rgya mtsho 'di lta ste /
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho 'di lta ste /
translated: Sāgaramati, it is like this:

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi nyon mongs pa 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa' khams gsum par kun tu sbyor ba la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi nyon mongs pa 'di dag gis byang chub sems dpa' khams gsum par kun tu sbyor ba la /
translated: These afflictions of such a nature bind the bodhisattvas to the three realms.

original: khams gsum pa yang kun nas nyon mongs pa las byung yin no //🔽de la byang chub sems @100a * //
analyzed: khams gsum pa yang kun nas nyon mongs pa las byung yin no // de la byang chub sems @100a * //
translated: And the three realms arise from afflictions.

original: dpa' ni thams la mkhas pa dang / dge pa'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed pas bsams bzhin du khams gsum du kun tu spyor te /
analyzed: dpa' ni thams la mkhas pa dang / dge pa'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed pas bsams bzhin du khams gsum du kun tu spyor te /
translated: There, the bodhisattvas, through skill in means and the power of their roots of virtue, intentionally bind themselves to the three realms.

original: des na dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called afflictions that are associated with roots of virtue.

original: ji srid khams gsum par kun tu sbyor ba yin gyi sems nye bar nyon mongs pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji srid khams gsum par kun tu sbyor ba yin gyi sems nye bar nyon mongs pas ni ma yin no //
translated: They bind themselves to the three realms, but not because their minds are afflicted.

original: slo gros rgya mtsho dper na /
analyzed: slo gros rgya mtsho dper na /
translated: Sāgaramati, it is like this:

original: tshong dpon nam khyim bdag la bu gcig pa 'dod pa sdug pa phangs pa yid du 'ong ba mthong na mi sdug pa med pa zhig yod la /
analyzed: tshong dpon nam khyim bdag la bu gcig pa 'dod pa sdug pa phangs pa yid du 'ong ba mthong na mi sdug pa med pa zhig yod la /
translated: Suppose there were a merchant or a householder who had an only son, who was dear to him, beloved, without rival, pleasing to the eyes.

original: khye'u de yang byis par gyur pas gar byed pa na mi gtsang ba'i dong du lhung bar gyur to //
analyzed: khye'u de yang byis par gyur pas gar byed pa na mi gtsang ba'i dong du lhung bar gyur to //
translated: And suppose that boy, being a child, playing in the dirt, fell into a cess-pit.

original: de nas khye'u de'i ma dang gnyen gnyis khye'u de mi gtsang ba'i dong du lhung ba de mthong la /
analyzed: de nas khye'u de'i ma dang gnyen gnyis khye'u de mi gtsang ba'i dong du lhung ba de mthong la /
translated: Then the boy’s mother and his relatives would see the boy fall into the cess-pit.

original: mthong nas kyang cho de chen po 'debs shing mya ngan byed la smre sngags 'don te /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang cho de chen po 'debs shing mya ngan byed la smre sngags 'don te /
translated: And having seen him, they would wail and lament, and cry out in distress.

original: mi gtsang ba'i dongs der zhugs te khye'u de 'don par mi byed do //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i dongs der zhugs te khye'u de 'don par mi byed do //
translated: But they would not enter the cess-pit and rescue the boy.

original: de nas khye'u de'i pha phyogs der song ste /🔽des bu gcig bu de mi gtsang ba'i dong du lhung ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nas khye'u de'i pha phyogs der song ste / des bu gcig bu de mi gtsang ba'i dong du lhung ba mthong ngo //
translated: Then the boy’s father, coming from some other place,🔽would see his only son fallen into the cess-pit.

original: mthong nas kyang rings pa rings par rtags pa'i tshul gyis bu gcig po 'don par 'dod pa'i sred pas byas te /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang rings pa rings par rtags pa'i tshul gyis bu gcig po 'don par 'dod pa'i sred pas byas te /
translated: And having seen him, he would quickly, with all speed, out of love for his only son,

original: sgyug bro ba med par mi gtsang ba'i gnas der babs te /
analyzed: sgyug bro ba med par mi gtsang ba'i gnas der babs te /
translated: Without any sense of shame, he went down into that filthy place.

original: bu gcig po phung bar gyur to //
analyzed: bu gcig po phung bar gyur to //
translated: His only son was lost.

original: blo gros rgya mtsho de ltar na 'di ni ji srid don 'di shes par bya ba'i phyir dper byas pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho de ltar na 'di ni ji srid don 'di shes par bya ba'i phyir dper byas pa'o //
translated: Sāgaramati, this is how I have used this analogy to illustrate this point.

original: don gang yin par blta zhe na /🔽blo gros rgya mtsho mi gtsang ba'i dong zhes bya ba 'di ni /
analyzed: don gang yin par blta zhe na / blo gros rgya mtsho mi gtsang ba'i dong zhes bya ba 'di ni /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: khams gsum pa'i tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i tshig bla dags so //
translated: Sāgaramati, the ‘filthy pit’ is a metaphor for the three realms.

original: bu gcig pa zhes bya ba 'di ni sems can gyi tshig bla dgas te /
analyzed: bu gcig pa zhes bya ba 'di ni sems can gyi tshig bla dgas te /
translated: ‘Only son’ is a metaphor for sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa'i 'du shes kyis nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa'i 'du shes kyis nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Bodhisattvas remain with the perception of their only son toward all sentient beings.

original: ma dang gnyen zhes bya ba 'di ni gang dag 'khor bar lhung ba'i sems can mthong nas mya ngan byed cing smra sngags 'don gyi /
analyzed: ma dang gnyen zhes bya ba 'di ni gang dag 'khor bar lhung ba'i sems can mthong nas mya ngan byed cing smra sngags 'don gyi /
translated: ‘Mother and relatives’ refers to those who, when they see sentient beings fallen into saṃsāra, feel sorrow and cry out,

original: 'don par nus pa ni med pa /
analyzed: 'don par nus pa ni med pa /
translated: but are unable to rescue them.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i gang zag rnams kyi tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i gang zag rnams kyi tshig bla dags so //
translated: It is the designation for the persons of the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas.

original: tshong dpon nam khyim bdag chen po zhes bya ba 'di ni gang zhig gtsang ba dri ma med pa dri ma dang bral ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: tshong dpon nam khyim bdag chen po zhes bya ba 'di ni gang zhig gtsang ba dri ma med pa dri ma dang bral ba'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: ‘Great merchant or householder’ is the designation for the bodhisattvas who have a pure, stainless, and unstained mind,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos mngon sum du rtogs pa /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos mngon sum du rtogs pa /
translated: who have realized the unconditioned Dharma,

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i @100b phyir bsams bzhin du khams gsum par mtshams sbyor bar byed pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshig bla dags so //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i @100b phyir bsams bzhin du khams gsum par mtshams sbyor bar byed pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshig bla dags so //
translated: and who, in order to ripen beings, intentionally take rebirth in the three realms.

original: blo bgros rgya mtsho mtshams sbyor ba thams cad las shin tu grol yang /
analyzed: blo bgros rgya mtsho mtshams sbyor ba thams cad las shin tu grol yang /
translated: Sāgaramati, although they are completely free from all rebirths,

original: srid par skye ba len pa gang len pa gan yin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje chen po ste /
analyzed: srid par skye ba len pa gang len pa gan yin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje chen po ste /
translated: they take rebirth in existence. This is the great compassion of the bodhisattvas.

original: thams la mkhas pa dang shes rab kyis yongs su zin pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dag gis kyang mi gnod la /
analyzed: thams la mkhas pa dang shes rab kyis yongs su zin pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dag gis kyang mi gnod la /
translated: They are not harmed by the afflictions because they are skilled in all phenomena and are sustained by wisdom.

original: nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba thams cad dgrol bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba thams cad dgrol bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to liberate all beings from the bonds of afflictions,

original: sems can rnams la chos kyang ston pa'o zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos kyang ston pa'o zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings.

original: des na mdo'i dum bu 'dis ni gzhan la phan par bya ba'i don du dbang dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / snying rje gnyis kyi stobs kyis bsams bzhin du skye ba la sbyor ba'i phyir dang / thams dang shes rab gnyis kyi stobs kyis de kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ma dag pa dang /
analyzed: des na mdo'i dum bu 'dis ni gzhan la phan par bya ba'i don du dbang dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / snying rje gnyis kyi stobs kyis bsams bzhin du skye ba la sbyor ba'i phyir dang / thams dang shes rab gnyis kyi stobs kyis de kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ma dag pa dang /
translated: Thus, this passage from the sutra teaches that for the sake of benefiting others, the roots of virtue and compassion of a bodhisattva who is powerful connect him with rebirth as he wishes, and due to the power of both method and wisdom, he is not defiled by afflictions.

original: dag pa'i gas skabs bstan to //
analyzed: dag pa'i gas skabs bstan to //
translated: Thus it teaches the impure and pure states.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba thob nas /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong ba thob nas /
translated: When bodhisattvas attain the vision that sees the unborn and nonarising thusness of the tathiigatagarbha just as it is,

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos nyid 'di rjes su thob pa de ltar ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos nyid 'di rjes su thob pa de ltar ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin rtogs par bya ste /
translated: they attain this reality of the bodhisattva.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽Sāgaramati, the essence of phenomena is essencelessness,

original: blo gros rgya mtsho chos rnams kyi snying po med pa nyid dang / byed pa po med pa nyid dang / bdag po med pa nyid dang / sems can med pa nyid dang / srog med pa nyid dang / gang zag med pa nyid dang /
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho chos rnams kyi snying po med pa nyid dang / byed pa po med pa nyid dang / bdag po med pa nyid dang / sems can med pa nyid dang / srog med pa nyid dang / gang zag med pa nyid dang /
translated: the absence of a creator, the absence of an owner, the absence of sentient beings, the absence of life, the absence of individuals,

original: bdag med pa nyid la ltos /
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid la ltos /
translated: and the absence of a self.🔽Look at this!

original: 'di ltar gang la ji ltar 'dod pa de ltar sems par mi byed /🔽rab tu rtogs par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang la ji ltar 'dod pa de ltar sems par mi byed / rab tu rtogs par mi byed do //
translated: In this way, one does not think or conceive of anything in any way.

original: blo gros rgya mtsho gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i chos 'di la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos gang la yang khong khro ba skye bar mi byed do //
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i chos 'di la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni chos gang la yang khong khro ba skye bar mi byed do //
translated: Sāgaramati, the bodhisattva who is inspired by this unchanging Dharma will not give rise to anger toward any phenomenon.

original: 'di la 'ga' yang phan 'dogs pa'am gnod par byed pa med do zhes de ltar de'i ye shes kyi mthong ba rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la 'ga' yang phan 'dogs pa'am gnod par byed pa med do zhes de ltar de'i ye shes kyi mthong ba rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will think, ‘Here, there is no one who benefits or harms.’ In this way, his wisdom vision will be purified.

original: de ltar chos rnams kyi chos nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / 'di ltar snying rje chen po'i go cha mi 'dor ba yin no //🔽blo gros rgya mtsho dper na nor bu rin po che bee d'u rya rin thang med @101a * //
analyzed: de ltar chos rnams kyi chos nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang / 'di ltar snying rje chen po'i go cha mi 'dor ba yin no // blo gros rgya mtsho dper na nor bu rin po che bee d'u rya rin thang med @101a * //
translated: In this way, they know the true nature of phenomena just as it is, and they do not cast off the armor of great compassion.

original: pa shin tu sbyangs pa shin tu yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: pa shin tu sbyangs pa shin tu yongs su dag pa /
translated: “Sāgaramati, it is like a priceless, flawless, pure, and immaculate vaiḍūrya gem.

original: shin tu dri ma med pa 'dam du bcug ste /
analyzed: shin tu dri ma med pa 'dam du bcug ste /
translated: It is placed in mud

original: lo stong phrag du ma gnas par gyur la /
analyzed: lo stong phrag du ma gnas par gyur la /
translated: and remains there for many thousands of years.

original: de lo stong 'das nas 'dam de nas phyung ste sbyangs shing byi dor byas te /🔽legs bar bkrus /
analyzed: de lo stong 'das nas 'dam de nas phyung ste sbyangs shing byi dor byas te / legs bar bkrus /
translated: After a thousand years, it is removed from the mud, polished,🔽washed well,

original: legs par sbyangs /
analyzed: legs par sbyangs /
translated: cleaned well,🔽and polished well.

original: legs par byi dor byas pa na dag cing dri ma med pa nor bu rin po che'i ngo bo de nyid mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: legs par byi dor byas pa na dag cing dri ma med pa nor bu rin po che'i ngo bo de nyid mi 'dor ro //
translated: It does not lose its nature as a pure, immaculate gem.

original: blo gros rgya mtsho de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams kyi sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar rab tu shes te /
analyzed: blo gros rgya mtsho de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams kyi sems rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar rab tu shes te /
translated: Sāgaramati, in the same way, bodhisattvas know that the minds of beings are luminous by nature.

original: 'on kyang glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nyon mongs par mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pas nyon mongs par mthong ngo //
translated: But they are seen to be afflictions because of the adventitious secondary afflictions.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: In this regard, the bodhisattva thinks as follows:

original: nyon mongs pa 'di dag ni sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal bar zhugs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'di dag ni sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal bar zhugs pa ma yin no //
translated: “These afflictions do not penetrate the clear light nature of the minds of sentient beings.

original: nyon mongs pa 'di dag ni glo bur ba ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'di dag ni glo bur ba ste /
translated: These afflictions are adventitious.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pas bskyed pa'o//
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pas bskyed pa'o//
translated: They are produced by unreal imagination.

original: bdag gis sems can 'di dag gi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir chos bstan par nus so snyam ste /
analyzed: bdag gis sems can 'di dag gi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir chos bstan par nus so snyam ste /
translated: I am able to teach the Dharma in order to pacify the secondary afflictions of these sentient beings.”

original: de ltar de la zhum pa'i sems mi skye'o //
analyzed: de ltar de la zhum pa'i sems mi skye'o //
translated: Thus, a discouraged mind does not arise in him.

original: de ni lan mang du sems can rnams kyi thad du rab tu 'gro ba'i sems skye'o //
analyzed: de ni lan mang du sems can rnams kyi thad du rab tu 'gro ba'i sems skye'o //
translated: He frequently generates the thought of going to sentient beings.

original: de 'di snyam du yang sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du yang sems te /
translated: He thinks as follows:

original: nyon mongs pa 'di dag la stobs dang mthu 'ga' yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'di dag la stobs dang mthu 'ga' yod pa ma yin te /
translated: “These afflictions do not have any power or strength.

original: nyon mongs pa 'di dag ni stobs med pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'di dag ni stobs med pa /
translated: These afflictions are powerless,

original: stobs chung ba /
analyzed: stobs chung ba /
translated: weak,

original: 'di dag la ni yang dag pa'i gnas 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'di dag la ni yang dag pa'i gnas 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no real basis for these.

original: nyon mongs pa 'di dag ni yang dag pa ma yin par kun tu brtags pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'di dag ni yang dag pa ma yin par kun tu brtags pa ste /
translated: These afflictions are unreal and imagined.

original: de ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshul bzhin du yid la byed pas brtags pa na khro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshul bzhin du yid la byed pas brtags pa na khro bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When one examines them with proper mental activity, in accordance with reality, one does not become angry.

original: de ni kho bos ci nas kyang 'brel bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar so sor brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni kho bos ci nas kyang 'brel bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar so sor brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should examine them in such a way that one does not become connected with them.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams dang ni ma 'brel ba legs kyi 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams dang ni ma 'brel ba legs kyi 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is better not to be connected with the afflictions, not to become connected with them.

original: gal te bdag nyon mongs pa rnams dang 'brel na /
analyzed: gal te bdag nyon mongs pa rnams dang 'brel na /
translated: If I were connected with the afflictions,

original: de ji ltar nyon mongs pa'i 'ching bas bcings pa'i sems can rnams nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba spang bar bya ba'i phyir chos bstan /
analyzed: de ji ltar nyon mongs pa'i 'ching bas bcings pa'i sems can rnams nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba spang bar bya ba'i phyir chos bstan /
translated: how could I teach the Dharma to beings who are bound by the fetters of the afflictions in order to abandon the fetters of the afflictions?

original: 'on kyang kho bos nyon mongs pa rnams dang yang ma 'brel la /
analyzed: 'on kyang kho bos nyon mongs pa rnams dang yang ma 'brel la /
translated: But I am not connected with the afflictions,

original: nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba spang ba'i phyir sems can rnams la @101b yang chos bstan bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba spang ba'i phyir sems can rnams la @101b yang chos bstan bar bya'o //
translated: I should teach the Dharma to sentient beings in order to abandon the bonds of the afflictions.

original: 'khor ba'i 'brel par byed pa dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de dag dang ni bdag gis sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'brel bar bya'o snyam mo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'brel par byed pa dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de dag dang ni bdag gis sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'brel bar bya'o snyam mo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: I should be connected to those afflictions that are connected to the roots of virtue that create the connection to cyclic existence, in order to bring sentient beings to maturity.

original: 'khor ba ni 'dir zag pa med pa'i dbyings na khams gsum pa'i gzugs brnyan yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus gsum yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'khor ba ni 'dir zag pa med pa'i dbyings na khams gsum pa'i gzugs brnyan yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus gsum yin par 'dod do //
translated: Here, cyclic existence is asserted to be the three mental bodies in the realm without conflict, which are reflections of the three realms.

original: de ni zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas mngon bar 'dus byas pa'i phyir 'khor ba yin la /
analyzed: de ni zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas mngon bar 'dus byas pa'i phyir 'khor ba yin la /
translated: It is cyclic existence because it is created by uncontaminated roots of virtue.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i las dang nyon mongs pas mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i las dang nyon mongs pas mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir //
translated: It is nirvāṇa because it is not created by contaminated karma and afflictions.🔽It is said:

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang de nyid de /🔽gang gi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang de nyid de /🔽gang gi dbang du byas nas /
translated: The three realms are the realm without conflict.

original: bcom ldan 'das de'i slad du byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de'i slad du byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Blessed One, for that reason, it is not created.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang de nyid 'dus byas pa dang 'dus ma byas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yang mchis so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang de nyid 'dus byas pa dang 'dus ma byas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yang mchis so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, nirvana is both created and uncreated.

original: de la 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas 'dres pa'i sems las byung ba kun tu spyod pa dang ldan pa'i phyir 'di dag pa dang ma dag pa'i gnas skabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas 'dres pa'i sems las byung ba kun tu spyod pa dang ldan pa'i phyir 'di dag pa dang ma dag pa'i gnas skabs zhes bya'o //
translated: In this regard, the state of purity and impurity is called the state of the mixture of created and uncreated because it is associated with the practice of the created and uncreated mental states.

original: de yang thogs pa med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa dang / snying rje chen po bsgoms pas zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa la mngon du phyogs pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i don du de mngon du mi byed pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa mngon du gyur pa la gtso bor rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang thogs pa med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa dang / snying rje chen po bsgoms pas zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa la mngon du phyogs pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i don du de mngon du mi byed pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa mngon du gyur pa la gtso bor rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is primarily established in the bodhisattva stage of the Manifested, because of the meditation on the unobstructed perfection of wisdom, the meditation on great compassion, the manifestation of the superknowledges that exhaust the defilements, and the non-manifestation of those for the sake of protecting the entire realm of sentient beings.

original: zag ba zad pa'i shes pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: zag ba zad pa'i shes pa las brtsams te /
translated: Beginning from the knowledge of the destruction of the defilements,

original: mi'i dper brjod pa ni ji skad gsungs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: mi'i dper brjod pa ni ji skad gsungs pa bzhin te /
translated: the human example is as stated.

original: rigs kyi bu de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' 'bad pa chen po dang / brtson pa chen po dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa brten par bsgrubs pas mngon par shes pa lnga skyed par byed do ;
analyzed: rigs kyi bu de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' 'bad pa chen po dang / brtson pa chen po dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa brten par bsgrubs pas mngon par shes pa lnga skyed par byed do ;
translated: Son of noble family, in the same way, the bodhisattva, through great effort, great striving, and the accomplishment of a firm superior attitude, generates the five superknowledges.

original: / bsam gtan dang mngon par shes pa la sems yongs su sbyang ba byas pa de la zag pa zad pa mngon du phyogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / bsam gtan dang mngon par shes pa la sems yongs su sbyang ba byas pa de la zag pa zad pa mngon du phyogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having trained the mind in concentration and superknowledge, he approaches the knowledge of the destruction of the defilements.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i don du snying rje chen po'i sems bskyed pas zag pa zad pa'i ye shes yongs su sbyang ba byas @102a * //🔽te / slar yang sems yongs su sbyang ba byas pas sa drug pa la chags pa med pa'i shes rab skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i don du snying rje chen po'i sems bskyed pas zag pa zad pa'i ye shes yongs su sbyang ba byas @102a * // te / slar yang sems yongs su sbyang ba byas pas sa drug pa la chags pa med pa'i shes rab skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: Having trained in the knowledge of the destruction of the defilements through generating the thought of great compassion for the sake of protecting all sentient beings,

original: zag pa zad pa la mngon du phyogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa la mngon du phyogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and again having trained the mind, he approaches the knowledge of the destruction of the defilements because non-conceptual wisdom arises on the sixth ground.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa mngon du gyur pa 'di la zag pa zad pa mngon du byas pa la dbang thob pas ni rnam par dag pa'i gnas skabs bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa mngon du gyur pa 'di la zag pa zad pa mngon du byas pa la dbang thob pas ni rnam par dag pa'i gnas skabs bstan to //
translated: Thus, in this bodhisattva stage, the bodhisattva, having attained mastery over the realization of the extinction of the outflows, demonstrates the stage of purity.

original: de lta bu'i bdag nyid du yang dag par zhugs pa de gzhan dag kyang yang dag par rtogs pa 'di nyid la gzhag par bya'o zhes snying rje chen pos log par zhugs pa'i sems can yongs su bskyab par 'dod /🔽pa ; zhi ba'i bde ba'i ro mi myang bar de'i thabs la byang bar byas pa'i 'khor ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i sems can la ltos te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bdag nyid du yang dag par zhugs pa de gzhan dag kyang yang dag par rtogs pa 'di nyid la gzhag par bya'o zhes snying rje chen pos log par zhugs pa'i sems can yongs su bskyab par 'dod / pa ; zhi ba'i bde ba'i ro mi myang bar de'i thabs la byang bar byas pa'i 'khor ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i sems can la ltos te /
translated: Having entered into such a state, he wishes to protect sentient beings who have entered into error by means of great compassion, thinking, “I will establish others in this very realization.”🔽Without tasting the bliss of peace, he is skilled in the means for that.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du phyogs pa /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du phyogs pa /
translated: He is oriented toward nirvana in relation to sentient beings who are oriented toward samsara.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan dag gi gnas nas slar 'dod pa'i khams su bsams bzhin du skye ba yongs su 'dzin pas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan dag gi gnas nas slar 'dod pa'i khams su bsams bzhin du skye ba yongs su 'dzin pas /
translated: In order to perfect the limbs of enlightenment, he takes up birth in the desire realm from the state of the meditative concentrations.

original: ji srid myur du sems can gyi don bya bar 'dod pas /🔽dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa rnam pa du mar skya ba'i bye brag gis /
analyzed: ji srid myur du sems can gyi don bya bar 'dod pas / dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa rnam pa du mar skya ba'i bye brag gis /
translated: As long as he wishes to work for the benefit of sentient beings,🔽he displays the bodies of all ordinary beings, through the various specific births that are included in the animal realm.

original: so so'i skye bo'i lus kun tu ston pa la dbang 'byor pas ni ma dag pa'i gnas skabs bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i lus kun tu ston pa la dbang 'byor pas ni ma dag pa'i gnas skabs bstan pa yin no //
